With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more yams and rice to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, James is an entrepreneur. He specializes in driving a taxi in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 30 years. James is married and has four children. His wife works as a farmer. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. James will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his taxi, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to further improve his taxi, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Vida did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Vida sells women’s accessories in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer and together they have one child. Vida uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Vida will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of women’s accessories, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Vida wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of women’s accessories

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La Sra. Nilda tiene 22 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 5 años,  ella   se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también frijol, papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Santo Corazon,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Nilda va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de frijol y para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, La Sra. Nilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida de la cliente y de su familia La Sra. Nilda es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is a crop farmer and has a five-year-old son.   She grows a variety of vegetables such as beans, potatoes, yucca plant and corn on her patch of land in the community of Santo Corazon.  This is her first loan through the institution.  Nilda plans to use the loan to prepare the land to plant beans.  The reason for requesting the loan is to have the resources to be able to do the planting and have some left over to live on.

Nilda is up against challenges in her business such as bad weather that on many occasions ruins her crops.  She will use the profits to improve her and her family's quality of life.  She is a responsible, hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support shown her through this loan.

loans.use: To prepare her land for bean planting.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Doña Maria de 57 años es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en casa propia. actualmente posee 3 molinos de carne los cuales son la fuente principal de sus ingresos tiene ya mas de 2 años de poseer este negocio con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria solicita un credito para la compra de repuestos para los molinos como cuchillas, discos, entre otras cosas pues esa es su unica fuente de trabajo y si ella podra darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, is married, has a son and lives in her own home.  She currently has three meat grinders which provide her with her main source of income.  For over two years she has been in business, using her profits to cover household expenses.  

Maria is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for her grinders, such as knives and disc plates, since this is the only work she has to provide for her family without limitation.

loans.use: To buy disc plates and knives for her meat grinders.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr Pedro sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida cuenta que le va muy bien,  el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su  negocio  y ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes,    creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, el anterior  crédito lo utilizo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida  como abarrotes y Aceite, se siente feliz y agradecido por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Pedro is still in the food business and he says it is going very well.  He will use the loan to buy tables and chairs to expand his business and make his customers more comfortable.  

Since he now has more customers and business has increased, so has his income.  He used the previous loan to buy supplies, such as groceries and oil to make the food.  He is happy and grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Delmin Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Delmin es una mujer de 30 años de edad y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores ya salieron de primaria y le ayudan con las actividades del campo como ser: Corte, Limpieza, Fertilización y abonar sus cultivos, el 3 va a la escuela aun y el ultimo es un menor de 4 años. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo terminar gracias a la ayuda de sus padres; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron el cultivo de café y junto a su esposo lo práctica ase más de 7 años el cual es comercializado y vendido con los compradores que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amistades cercanas. Las tierras que juntos en familia cultivan son propias ya que pudieron obtenerlo por medio de una herencia que sus padres le dejaron el cual está ubicado a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Doña Delmin solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio de los cuales podrá darle una mejor asistencia y mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos para que sus cosechas sean 100% productivas.

Sus metas son de poder ampliar sus cultivos para que esto puedan generar mejores ingresos para su familia y para su hogar de esta forma ella podrá cumplir sus sueños de darles la oportunidad a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y se puedan graduar de la secundaria y posterior mente de la universidad.
texts.en:
Delmin, 30, has four children, two of whom have finished primary school and help with the farm work, such as cutting, cleaning and fertilizing the crops.  The third child still attends school and the youngest is four years old.  Delmin received a complete first level of primary education thanks to her parents' support but was unable to continue because of a lack of resources.  Her parents taught her how to cultivate coffee and she and her husband have been in the business for over seven years.  She sells to buyers who visit the area, and to neighbors and close friends.  They own their own land which they inherited from her parents and it is two kilometers from their house.  They walk to work every day.

Delmin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.  She wants to provide adequate crop maintenance so her harvest will be 100% productive.

Her goal is to expand her plantation so she can generate more income for the family and household.  This is so she can fulfill her dream of giving her children the opportunity to continue their education, graduate from high school and then go on to get a university degree.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Vera

texts.es:
Perfil Vera
Chilamate, Poas
500.000



Vera es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, tubo 3 créditos con el Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate, del cual se retiró ya que se dedico a cuidar a su madre, quién ya murió. Después el Banco no la reincorporó por asuntos internos. Ella ha mantenido ventas de comidas principalmente ceviche los fines de semana en su casa y además tiene un vehículo con el que se dedican a realizar servicios de transporte en su comunidad, ya que no cuenta con este servicio, y se deben desplazar cerca de 1 km para tomar el bus, por lo que muchas personas acuden a su familia. El vehículo está varado a causa de un accidente el cual está en un proceso legal. Por lo que solicitan este préstamo para repararlo y ponerlo en funcionamiento mientras se resuelve el asunto legal. 

También ante la difícil situación económica, labora ahora como domestica en una casa en Alajuela, por lo 3 días a la semana debe salir de su casa luego de preparar la comida de su esposo quien también labora en la Ciudad de Alajuela, ambos salen en bus y regresan en la tarde. Terminando las labores domésticas de su hogar.

 La clienta requiere de este préstamo para apoyar a la familia en los ingresos económicos que generaba con la actividad de transporte. Existe el compromiso del esposo y su hijo, con los quien vive, a apoyar a vera en esta actividad

La clienta mantiene una pequeña actividad de subsistencia y la complementa con el trabajo doméstico,  es una familia pobre que el servicio prestado con el vehículo le genera un ingreso importante, por esto se requiere su reparación y para esto acuden a Fundación Mujer y a Kiva para que se les apoye en esta en esta difícil situación.  Cuando Vera  trabajo en el grupo demostró una excelente conducta de pago.
texts.en: Vera lives in Poas, Chilamate, and wants to borrow 500,000 colones. She is a humble, hard-working woman, and she had three loans with a communal bank named 'Mujeres emprendedoras de Chilamate' (meaning 'women entrepreneurs of Chilamate'). She had to leave the bank to care for her mother and, following her death, she was not able to join the bank again for administrative reasons. Vera sells food, mainly ceviche, at her house on week-ends, but her main activity is transportation services in her area, since there is no public transport there, the nearest bus station being one kilometre away. Many neighbours thus come to her for transportation. Her taxi was in an accident, and while she took the persons responsible to court, it is in need of repairs in the meantime. This is why she asks for a loan to repair it while waiting for the legal proceedings to come to an end. In view of her dire financial situation, Vera took another job to compensate for the loss of earnings from her transportation business. She is now a domestic worker in a house in Alajuela: three days a week, she leaves the house after preparing a meal for her husband, who works in the same city, and they take the bus together and come back in the afternoon. Vera then has to do housework in the evenings. She asks for this loan in order to be able to help support her family through her transportation business again. Her husband and her son, with whom she lives, are very supportive of her resuming her transportation activity. Vera's business is very small and she needs to complement it with other sources of income. Since her family is very poor, the income derived from her transportation business is essential to their survival. Repairs are therefore urgent. Vera turns to field partner Fundación Mujer and to Kiva lenders for support through these difficult times. When Vera was a member of the communal bank, she was always on time for repayments.

loans.use: to repair her taxi.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María cristina vive en una comarca situada en la parte sur de la capital es casada con dos pequeños hijos a su cargo los cuales están en edad escolar.

Se desempeña como secretaria en un centro de estudios universitario de la capital desde hace dos años.

Doña María solicita un financiamiento a kiva y ceprodel  para hacer la inversión de  compra de zinc y perlines para el cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que considera necesario para  hacer ese cambio antes que entre el invierno para que no se le pase el agua a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Cristina lives in the southern area of the capital.  She is married and has two small children who attend school.  She has worked as a secretary at a university in the capital for two years.

María is requesting a loan through Kiva and Ceprodel to buy zinc sheeting and profiles to change the roof on her house.  She feels this is necessary to do before winter arrives so water does not filter into the house.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and profiles.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina,de 47 años de edad , está casada con Andréss, con quien tiene 1 hijo de 5 años , con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de material noble.Los verdes campos de la cuenca, son muy productivos la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican al cultivo de piña en todas sus variedades. Hace tan solo 4 años que viene dedicándose a la siembra de piña, cítricos y cacao; desde muy temprano se levanta para limpiar sus plantaciones de las malezas que crecen en sus campos; gracias a los cuidados  que le brinda; todas sus cosecha son reconocidas por su buena calidad y en temporadas de cultivo los mismos comercializadores vistan su terrenos agrícolas para negociar sus frutos. Ahora dentro de muy pocos meses cosechara varias hectáreas de naranja; los cuales ya tienen comprador. Viendo la demanda de sus productos Delfina está pensando en adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con los que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos.Delfina, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de piña y cítricos, con el fin de mantenerlos en buen estado.
texts.en:
Delfina, who is 47 years old, is married to Andréss. They have one child who is 5 years old and lives with them in their house which is built with quality construction materials. The green fields in the basin are very productive. Most of the residents in the area work growing pineapples, all varieties of pineapple. 
She only started sowing pineapple 4 years ago. She also grows citrus fruits and cacao. She gets up very early in the morning to weed the fields where her crops grow. The care that she gives to her plants results in crops that are renowned for their high quality. In fact, during the growing season sellers visit her farm to negotiate for her harvest.

In a few months’ time she will harvest several hectares of orange. She has a buyer for them already. Given the demand for her products, Delfina is thinking about buying more farmland. This would enable her to meet customer demand. 

This is her third loan from Kiva. She hopes that you will be interested in collaborating with her to continue working towards her goals. Delfina will invest the S/.1500 soles in the purchase of manure, which she will spread between her pineapple and citrus fruit plots, so that she can keep them the plants in good condition.

loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is an entrepreneur, although she has received no prior formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a blacksmith. 

Efua prepares and sells ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves) and can be found selling it in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 12 years. The proceeds from her ‘Wakye’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and beans, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans, helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 59-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children. Claudia lives with her family in Sikatuna, Bohol. She is engaged in food vending and clothing and cosmetics sales. This is the source of her income. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, baking soda and oil and additional cosmetics and clothing for her clothing sales. Through this, she will be able to sell more and increase her sales and profit. In the future, Claudia hopes to make her business a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, baking soda and oil and additional cosmetics and clothing for her clothing sales

loans.name: Richar Yefri

texts.es: Richar de 33 años de edad se dedica a la agriculrura siembra frijoles y maíz, el vive junto a su esposa e hijos, y se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien trabaja muy duro por salir adelante tambien trabaja de albañil, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y el pago por su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar.  él solicita un credito por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de semilla de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, así mismo desea comprar unos depósitos para colocar la cosecha y de esta forma mantenerla siempre fresca, y asi asegurarse de brindar siempre la mejor a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Richar is 33 years old and makes a living in the cultivation of bean and corn. He lives with his wife and children and stands out for being a very responsible and hard-working person, who works very hard to get ahead. He also works as a bricklayer, and with the income from his sales and the payment for his work he covers some of his household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan so he can have the money to invest in the purchase of a bigger quantity of corn and bean seed to plan. He would also like to buy tanks to store the harvest, for it to remain fresh. This way he can make sure that he always provides the best for his family, without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and bean.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling beans and maize near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years.

Efua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying for their children’s school fees.

Efua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of beans and maize to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of beans and maize

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is single and has one child. After successfully graduating Junior High School, Paulina is now an established businesswoman. She sells beans and plantains in Onyaadze (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven months. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Paulina uses her income to provide for her family. Paulina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of beans and plantains, thus helping her improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to diversify the type of products that she sells to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase beans and plantains

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo José vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es casado, tiene tres persona a su cargo y labora en una universidad del estado desde hace tres años desempeñándose como agente de seguridad.
  
Esta solicitando crédito a CEPRODEL para poder hacer un anexo de un cuarto para ampliar la sala de su casa y este crédito lo utilizara en compra de bloque, cemento, y pago de mano de obra.

Con este financiamiento lo invertirá en mejorar su vivienda y agradece a kiva a través de Ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, porque solo así a podido ir  acondicionando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo José lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a responsible person who fights for the well being and future of his family. He is married and has three dependents. He has worked at a state university for three years as a security guard.
  
He is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to be able to build an annex on a room to expand the living room of his house. He will use this loan to buy blocks and cement and to pay for labor costs. 

With this loan, he will invest in doing home improvements. He is grateful to Kiva through Ceprodel for the support they can offer him, because this is the only way he has been able to remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña Maria de 63 años de edad es una persona responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo amable ella se dedica a  comercializar todo tipo de ropa de forma ambulante en los lugares que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su familia, Doña Maria esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda de clientes por vender a buen precio sus mercaderias y asi pueda obtener mejores ingresos economicos para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 63 years old. She is a responsible, hardworking and above all kind woman. She sells all types of clothing as a street vendor in places close to her home. She lives in her own home with her family. Maria is asking for a loan that will allow her to be able to buy more merchandise to stock her business, since their is a lot of demand from customers. She can sell her merchandise at a good price and thus obtain better income and have a better life with her mother.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin, 52, is a married mother of four children. She lives in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. 

The source of her family’s income is rice farming on one hectare of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for 30 years. 

This is the first loan for Nin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Nin wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa, 37, is a husband and a father of four children. He is a native of Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman. Three of his children are attending primary school and the other is not of school-going age. 

Issa works at a sugar-producing company in Sierra Leone. He has been on the staff at this company for 10 years now. In addition to his work at the company, Issa is also a businessman who sells used clothes and gara lappers (locally dyed cloths). He has been a businessman for five years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
For years, Mjeni has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, operating a door-to-door service whereby town dwellers and neighbors are her potential clients. She mentioned that during the rainy season, it becomes hard to operate her business, hence a low income is then earned.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for the transport business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of obtaining a license for the business and also transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to wholesale in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 30 bags of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 35 años de edad joven, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse. Ella está en una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una familia muy numerosa compuesta por 6 hijos de los cuales los tres mayores están estudiando a nivel primario, 2 no estudian y un recién nacido. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña y tiene 5 años de dedicarse junto a su pareja esta actividad. El terreno que ella junto a su pareja cultivan es propio ya que fue una herencia de parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 70 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día Ana solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio del cual podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus sueños son los de ver a sus hijos culminados a nivel universitario, que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
María  is a 35 year old woman. She is young, a fighter, enterprising and really wants to get ahead. She is in a common law marriage and has a big family with six children. The three oldest are in primary school. 2 aren't in school and one is a newborn. She doesn't have any education and was unable to go to school because her parents were of low income. They were the ones who taught her to work the land since she was very small. For 5 years, she has worked with her spouse at this activity. They land she plants with her spouse is their own since it was inherited from one of her parents. It is located 70 meters from her house and they walk there every day.

Today Ana is asking for help to buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee crops so she can have a healthy crop that she can benefit from 100%. 

Her dreams are to see her children finish college and have better opportunities in life and in work. Working the land is very difficult and the profits are low.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 23 years old. He lives in the small village of Khulo District with his parents and brother. Lasha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have calves and a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested potatoes locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lasha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lasha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Lasha will purchase phone accessories. He has rented a commercial space, where he plans to sell phone accessories. He will work there and also offer to repair his clients' damaged phones. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to resell.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en: Eutropia earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods to the people in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She needs a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap, toiletries and other items. She believes that if she will be granted a loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is a 35-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives with her husband, Lhamragchaa, and four sons between 1 and 16 years old in a ger (traditional yurt) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

She had been living in countryside for years, breeding livestock and producing organic dairy products until 2012. She needed to move to the province center in order to send her children to schools. She and her husband are concerned about their sons' educations and plan to send all of them to universities for whichever studies their children want too pursue. 

She has just started her clothes retail business in the local market and needs some financial support. So she is now requesting loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her new clothes retail business. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and smart lady.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new clothes retail business.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Gibrilla, an engineer at a sugar producing company in Sierra Leone. The 36-year-old engineer is married to a businesswoman, and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary school while the other is still not of school-going age. 

Gibrilla has been working at the sugar company for four years now. In addition to his engineering work, Gibrilla is also a businessman. He sells cosmetics, body lotions, sprays, etc. He has been a businessman for nine years now. With this loan, Gibrilla is going to buy cosmetics, body lotions, sprays, etc., in a larger quantity to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, body lotions, sprays, etc., in a larger quantity to add to his current stock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has operated a kiosk retail shop business for years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: G.s Thelmo Ruiz#5 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Floriselva es una persona muy trabajadora y  responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus  2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Floriselva vende de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en los caseríos cercanos a ella, Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal y leña que necesita para la elaboración de su producto. 
Doña Floriselva espera que este préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a este contara con lo insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto y de igual manera que sus ventas aumenten para que gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Doña Floriselva espera en unos años que su negocio crezca y con esto poder apoyar a su familia parq que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña María tiene 27 años, su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años.
Doña Iris tiene 28 años, su negocio es la venta de bolsas plásticas desde hace 5 años



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Floriselva is a very hardworking and responsible person who, along with her two children, lives in a town in the south of Honduras.  She has, for the last five years, been making tortillas which she sells in the street in her town and in nearby villages.  She needs a loan to buy more raw materials such as corn, lime and firewood, which she needs to make her products.  Floriselva hopes that this loan will be of great help to her as it will enable her to obtain the supplies she needs to continue producing tortillas and, at the same time, boost her sales and use the increased income to improve her own and her family's lifestyle.  Floriselva hopes to see her business grow over the next few years, which will enable her to support her family and allow her children to continue their education and become good people with better life prospects.  María, who is 27, has been selling tortillas for 8 years and Iris, who is 28, has been selling plastic bags for 5 years.  



Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood for her business

loans.name: Thuweiba

texts.en:
Thuweiba is married to Mohammed, and they are blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Thuweiba operates a tailoring business, making women’s and gents' suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenges. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 50, is a native of Makapra village in northern Sierra Leone. 

Mohamed is a husband and a father of eight children. Three of his children are attending primary school and five are attending secondary schools. 

Mohamed works at a sugar-producing company in Sierra Leone. He has been on the staff at this company for nine years now. In addition to his work at the company, he is also a businessman. He has been a businessman for five years now, selling rice, etc. 

He has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of rice to sell.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Deogratias, who is in his mid 40s, is a married man with four children, three of whom are in school, and the remaining one is still small. For a period of three years now, Deogratias has been operating a grocery business, often offering different drinks, both alcoholic and soft drinks. He is doing fine in this field and his family is also. He works from 3:00pm to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, he increased his business inventory, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. With the interest earned, he bought another plot of land and covered home expenses and school fees. He will use this loan to restock more drinks and pay for toilet repair at his business. He dreams of having a nice guesthouse for business expansion. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "WITO" which totals 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more drinks and pay for toilet repair at his business.

loans.name: Ndejje Tusuubiradev. Team_ New Group

texts.en:
Bonny is a father of four children, age 10, 6, 4, and 2. 

He has a hair salon on a busy street in the town and has been doing this business for 14 years. This business has helped him look after his family including three other children who belong to his elder brother. He agreed to help out with school fees for these children because his brother's income is too low to allow him to pay fees. 

Bonny hopes that his business can become more and more popular so that he can attract many customers. With this loan he would like to purchase hair dryers.

His challenge is that when he tries to raise his prices,  it discourages his clients and they stop coming to the salon. He therefore has to work longer hours to try to make more money. He wishes that he was able to access bigger loans at a cheaper rate.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers.

loans.name: Juan  José

texts.es:
El señor juan José vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como higienista en un centro de compra de Managua desde hace  doce años tiempo he a aprovecha ya que  sus  ingreso sirven para el sustento de su familia.

Juan José está solicitando un crédito para  la compra de zinc para su vivienda ya que necesita hacer el cambio de techo de su vivienda manifestando que gracias a los créditos otorgados en ceprodel ha mejorado su vivienda para darle una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan José lives in the city of Managua. He has worked as a cleaner in a shopping center in Managua for two years. He has used that time well and his income supports his family. 

Juan José is asking for a loan to buy zinc sheeting for his home. He needs to change the roof. He says that he is grateful for the loans he has been given in Ceprodel. They have improved his home to give more comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Leandro Antonio

texts.es: leandro de 37 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa propia, leandro es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos y tambien a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados y en la compra de insumos agricolas ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y otras cosas que necesita para su siembra. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en: Leandro is 37 year old. He lives with his family in a home he owns. Leandro is a hardworking, responsible, and very enterprising man. For several years, he has worked producing and selling dairy products. He also farms, planting corn and beans. He has very good customers since he knows how to earn their trust. He offers quality and good prices with his products. He has decided to invest in caring for his cattle and in buying agricultural materials, since his business depends on it. That is why he has asked for a loan to be able to buy vitamins for the cattle and manure, seeds, fertilizer and other things that he needs for planting. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue to offer financial help to his home, where it is much needed.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for cattle, manure, seeds, and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Mohamed T.

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 35-year-old man who is a native of Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has eight children. Three of his children are attending primary school and five are attending secondary school.
 
Mohamed has worked in a sugar-producing company for 10 years. In addition to his work at the company, he is also an agriculturist and a businessman. 

Mohamed has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,750,000 in order to meet his most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And the end of each month, he can easily repay the loan, using his monthly salary. It is the company’s financial manager who deducts his repayments and repays SMT/Kiva lenders on his behalf. 

He is going to invest part of this loan in agriculture and part in business. He will buy gara producing materials like ink, caustic soda, powder, etc., for the production of a larger quantity of gara cloth (traditional dyed cloth) for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials like ink, caustic soda, powder, etc. for the production of a larger quantity of gara cloth for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a farmer from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. Helen is has been in the farming business for more than seven years. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In this way, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Helen hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 42 years old. He lives in Shrosha village, Akhmeta district, with his 35-year-old wife, Nino, and three children (3, 9 and 10 years old). Khvicha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have two milk cows and a pig. The cows are milked every day to make dairy products, which is sold at the local markets. From the pig they have piglets and also sell them at the market. Additional family income is Nino’s monthly salary. She is a teacher at the local school. 

Khvicha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Khvicha will purchase a mini-bus. He wants to start trading in fruits and vegetables. He will purchase products at the wholesale price from his villagers and sell them in nearby villages with a price markup. This will bring him a good profit and he will be able to look after for his big family better and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Loboc, Bohol. Susana is also into a hog raising venture. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and also more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her businesses as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and also more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. Rahel owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Rahel operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. He is still working as a blacksmith. 

After being funded by KADET Ltd., Nelson's income has increased to KES 14,500. He is very grateful for the financial support that was extended to him. He plans to use the loan to buy more scrap metals.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 38 years old and a single mother of two children, 19 and 2 years old. 

She has been operating her dry cleaner shop for a period of about seven years with an income of approximately KES 20,000 a month.

This is her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use it to buy an extra laundry machine. She hopes to grow her business and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy an extra laundry machine.

loans.name: Mwagomba

texts.en: Mwagomba appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped him to run his business well and gain a good profit. Here he comes again for another loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase more spare parts, like tubes, bulbs and brake cables for his business. He thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts, like tubes, bulbs and brake cables for his business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been running properly, and he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, because of a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the repairs. So Nazia has applied for for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the costs. This will help him to continue his business. Nazia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband’s rickshaw.

loans.name: John M

texts.en: Presented to you in the photo is John, a plumber at a sugar producing company in Sierra Leone. The 52-year-old plumber is married to a businesswoman, and the couple have five children, who are attending secondary schools. John has been working at the sugar company for nine years. With this loan, John is going to buy building materials, including corrugated iron sheets, cement and nails, to build house for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including corrugated iron sheets, cement and nails, to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en: Mariam, who is in her mid-30s, is married and has two kids, a boy and a girl, who are in school. For a year, Mariam has been able to cover her family’s costs by running a fruit and vegetable business. She is doing okay in her business. She works from 6 am to 3 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be her tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of were repaid successfully, she managed to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables. With the profits, she has bought a TV set, a bed, and a cupboard, and she has also paid school fees for her kids. She will use this loan to open a new place and sell sarongs. She dreams of being able to build a house some day. She will share this loan with her loan group, Jasiri Group, which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new place and sell sarongs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a small store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 22-year-old man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a water selling business. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in an area with many customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of consistent water supply. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaitun is a married woman who has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a posho mill grinding machine business for over five years; she operates at the market where neighbors are the potential customers. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bags of maize for resale. She dreams of expanding her business by purchasing another grinding machine in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is requesting another loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which he will use to to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.  The loan will help to boost his fruits and vegetables stall.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa  tiene 18 años, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de canastas de madera,   ella  vende de manera ambulante por las ferias y mercados de la ciudad de Santa cruz, también entrega a distintos puestos de venta,    este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Teresa  va a usar este préstamo  para la fabricación de sus canastas,  La Sra. Teresa  enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que el trabajo es de manera manual y es un trabajo muy tedioso y duro,  La Sra. Teresa  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Teresa, who is 18, makes wooden baskets and then travels around the various fairs and markets in the city of Santa Cruz to sell them. She also sells them from a number of outlets.  This is Teresa's first loan cycle with the institution and she plans to use the loan to make baskets.  Teresa's work brings it challenges - it is manual work and is tedious and tough.  Teresa is happy and grateful to the institution for granting her the loan and for the help it has provided.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single mother with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, cooking mahamri (dumplings) and selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socios exitosos originario de Masaya cada quien con sus pequeños negocios, uno de ellos es Eliezer tiene 25 años de edad, soltero, tiene tres años de dedicarse a fabricar y a  vender sandalias de niños, estos productos los comercializa por encargo en el mercado de Masaya, lleva un año de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como cuero, pega, hilo, galletas, plantilla, hebillas, suela esponja, alistada, montada. Mansfield tiene 24 años de edad su negocio es la venta de fajas y bolsos, Xiomara tiene 26 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Fabiola tiene 32 años y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four successful members from Masaya.  Each one of them has a small business.

Eliezer, age 25, is one of them, and he is single.  For three years he has been making and selling children’s sandals.  He sells these products by order at the market in Masaya.  He has been a client of the institution for one year.

He will use the loan to buy raw material like leather, glue, thread, insoles, buckles, foam soles, lasts, and molds.

Mansfield is 24 years old, and his business is selling belts and bags.  Xiomara, age 26, sells cosmetics.  Fabiola, age 32, has a business selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy material for making shoes.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man and the father of two children, from the town of Loboc, Bohol. He a jeepney driver. Jeepneys are a means of transportation in the Philippines. He is also in the motorcycle transport business and has a hog-raising venture. Michael is applying for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and to pay for repairs to the passenger truck and the motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs and pay for the repair of his passenger truck and motorcycle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has three children who attend school. Her husband is a police officer.  Rose has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. 

Rose is requesting a loan from Yehu for 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cloth and thread for her business. She joined Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.  She and her husband own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. 

She operates a rental house business where she rents houses to tenants. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to renovate rental houses which she owns. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years.

loans.use: to renovate rental houses which she owns.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 36 años de edad es un hombre humilde y muy responsable, vive en la casa de su madre y tras la muerte de su padre , vive en compañia de su esposa, su hijo y su mamá.Juan es mototaxista y desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta actividad, pero por mucho tiempo lo hacia como chofer de otros, fue un vecino quien le propuso que trabaje en su mototaxi, y así fue como empezó en esta actividad luego se compro su propio vehiculo .Ahora trabajando independientemente espera brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y con sus ahorra espera poder comprar otro mototaxi.Este es su primer crédito de Kiva y esta muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido. Por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el dinero solicitado de S/.700.00 espera arreglar su mototaxi, por que esta presentando algunas fallas que le impide salir a trabajar.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old.  He is a humble and responsible man who lives in his mother's house.  Since the death of his father, he lives together with his wife, his son, and his mother.  Juan has worked as a mototaxi driver for 10 years.  For much of that time, he worked as a driver for others, until one of his neighbors suggested that he work with his mototaxi, and that was how he started this type of work.  Later, he purchased his own vehicle and now he works independently.  He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and with his savings, he hopes to purchase another mototaxi.  

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support.  He promises to make his repayments on time.  With the 700 soles he is requesting, he hopes to repair his mototaxi, which has a few faults that prevent him from going out to work.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 31-year-old single man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a household goods store where he sells utensils, electric appliances and other household goods. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with many customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to add a stock of utensils, electric appliances and other household goods. His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of utensils, electric appliances and other household goods

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. For the past two years, he has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business.He sells from his home to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

Ndegwa is requesting a loan from Yehu for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to sell. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business. Ndegwa owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay school fees.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a clothing retail store, which she has been doing for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with many customers. 

Miriam is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase clothes to sell.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. Her business goal is to have a big business and a hotel within five years.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Gamila

texts.en:
Gamila is 57 years old. She lives in Gardabani District with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Gamila requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gamila requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Gamila has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the credit, Gamila will purchase a car. After purchasing a car her husband will serve local people as a taxi driver and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past twenty years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation, and stiff competition. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, with which she might boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables to resell at her business.

loans.name: Utamaduni . Group

texts.en:
Stela, who is in her early 50s, is married, with four grown children. She is living with her three grandchildren, who are in school. 

For a period of four years now, Stela has had a grocery business, offering different drinks. She works from 2pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be Stela's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, which paid back successfully, she managed to buy more beers and sodas. With the profit received, she covered home expenses and school fees. 

Stela will use this loan to buy additional grocery drinks. She dreams to build a house. 

Stela will share this loan with her loan group, Utamaduni, which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery drinks.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is married and has two children who attend school. She operates a beauty salon business at the market, which she has been doing for three years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Prudence is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay school fees and add stock for her beauty salon business. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees and add stock for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en:
Pictured here is Momoh, a staff member in one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. He has served the sugar company for nine years. A native of Magbass village, the 37-year-old man is married to a businesswoman, and the couple has five children, three of whom are attending primary school. Another child is in secondary school.

In addition to his work at the sugar company, Momoh also makes and sells gara cloth (locally dyed cloth). He has been doing business in cloth for five years, now. He has requested this loan in order to produce more gara cloth, to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to produce gara cloth, to add to his current stock available for sale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is single and has two children who attend school. She operates a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar, which she has been doing for one year. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other retail operators.

Salome is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina's businesses are still doing well especially after getting funding from KADET LTD . She used the funds to expand her boutique and she is very grateful for getting the support. 

She is requesting another business loan to buy clothes in bulk to stock in her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Shown in the picture above is Moses, a borrower who has come to SMT, one of Kiva's partners in Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 1,200,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, Moses will be able to expand his business. He will use it to buy more rice to add to his current stock. 

Moses is a native of Masposo village in northern Sierra Leone. He is 39 years old and is married with 8 children. Three of his children are attending primary school and 5 are attending secondary schools. Moses is on staff at a sugar producing company and has been working in this company for 10 years now. However, in addition to his work at the sugar producing company, he also sells rice and has been a businessman for 5 years now.

loans.use: to buy more rice to add to his current stock.

loans.name: G.s Nueva Esperanza#2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Sandra tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación, necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal y leña, que necesita para la elaboración de su producto.
Doña Sandra espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto, además que sus ventas aumenten y  gracias a esto beneficiar el estilo de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Sandra al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera hacer que su negocio crezca y con esto seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y que  tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.
Don José tiene 43 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 8 años.
Doña Sandra tiene 46 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y tortillas desde hace 5 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking and honest person.  She lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras with her husband and their two children.  She has had a business selling tortillas for 5 years.  Sandra's business is located in her home, and she is requesting this loan to purchase more primary materials such as corn, lime, and firewood, which she needs to make her product.  Sandra hopes that this loan will help her a lot since she does not have the necessary supplies to continue making tortillas since her sales have increased.  This increase of income into the household has benefited her family's lifestyle.

Sandra, as well as her fellow group members, hopes that her business grows so that she can continue supporting her famly and her children can continue to attend school so that they can become good people who have more opportunities in the future.

Jose is 43 years old and has worked selling used clothing for 8 years.
Sandra is 46 years old and has worked selling used clothing and tortillas for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for their business.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 24 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District with his 24-year-old wife and parents.  Akaki has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows and two pigs. Also they own a vineyard and plot of agricultural land where they grow vegetables. The cows are milked to make dairy products, and from the pigs they get piglets, which are sold with the dairy and harvested products locally at the markets. Akaki also has a car and he drives it as a taxi to earn additional income for the family. 
Akaki requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Akaki has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Akaki will purchase calves. He wants to expand his agricultural business. He will raise the calves and sell them at a better price and earn additional income. He will reinvest part of the profit in the same business and he will use another part to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Evaristo Joaquin

texts.es: Don evaristo de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el tiene un taller de costura desde hace 35 años eso le ha dado la experiencia en todo tipo de costuras, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Evaristo quiere terminar de arreglar su casa pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar los materiales necesarios como: laminas, hierro, balcones, y mano de obra para mejorar sus vivienda y poder terminar de poner el techo, las puertas y las ventanas y pueda vivir mas seguro con su esposa.
texts.en: Evaristo, who is 64, lives with his wife in their own home.  He has had a sewing workshop for 35 years, which has allowed him to gain experience in all  types of sewing.  What he earns just covers the household expenses.  Evaristo wants to complete building work on his house but his earnings are not sufficient.  Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy the necessary materials such as metal sheeting, iron and balconies and to pay contractors to carry out improvements on his home, such as completing the installation of the roof and putting in doors and windows.  This will allow him and his wife to live in greater security.

loans.use: to buy materials such as metal sheeting, iron, balconies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 35 years old and a business man. He operates a retail shop, a business he has been running for the past four years. With this business he earns a monthly income of KES 8,900. He is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid his previous loans successfully. 

He plans to use the loan to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, salt and sugar to resell. He will use the anticipated profits to open a butchery. He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, salt, and sugar.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is applying for another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to boost her clothing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. 

She dreams of expanding her business to a boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bulaale Butawuka Balimi Group

texts.en:
Fatumah is a member of Bulaale Butawuka Balimi Group. She is a 50-year-old, single lady who deals in firewood trade in Bulo town. She lives in a four-room, dilapidated house, together with six of her ten children and four grandchildren. Four of them attend school and it’s Fatumah who meets their basic needs as well as their school fee requirements from her hard-earned savings. 

She began her firewood trade business eight years ago to acquire money and to support her family, after separating from her husband. In addition to the firewood trade, Fatumah also began a milk trade and now she needs money to buy more milk containers to preserve milk better, so that she can take her diary business to another level. She thinks this will enable her to meet her future dream of acquiring a plot of land and developing it for her family.
.

loans.use: to buy milk canisters.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you Brima, a staff at one of the sugar producing companies in Sierra Leone. This 40-year-old is a native of Magbass village, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has 5 children – 2 whom are in primary school and 3 whom are in secondary school. Brima has been working in this company for 10 years now.  He has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00. He will use this loan to invest in agriculture. Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Brima with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture

loans.name: Ivonne Liseth

texts.es: Doña Ivonne una señora trabajadora, su esposo es panadero, ella madre que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos aun siendo ellos independientes, doña Ivonne continua con su labor haciendo bocadillos los cuales vende por encargo y ambulante, a su edad recorre un largo camino para poder vender sus productos, con los que pretende salir adelante junto a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para continuar levantando la construcción de su vivienda lo que ha venido haciendo por partes.
texts.en: Ivonne is a very hardworking woman, and she is a mother who is dedicated to the wellbeing of her children, even though they are now grown. Her husband is a baker, and Ivonne cooks small food dishes that she sells as she travels all around her community. She uses the income she generates from this business to help provide for her family. Ivonne is requesting this loan in order to purchase construction materials for use in making improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, blocks, sand and stone for a construction project on her house.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Antonio vive en Managua capital de Nicaragua, es trabajador activo de una empresa del estado donde labora como agente de seguridad desde hace tres años, su estado civil casado con tres hijos a su cargo.

El crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales tales como lamina de cinz, perlines para da le mantenimiento  a su techo de su vivienda que esta en mal estado.

Los sueños de Don Miguel Antonio es ver su casita con el techo bueno por que se aproxima la lluvia y darle a su familia un techo digno  con el apoyo que Ceprodel y kiva le pueda brindarle.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel Antonio lives in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is actively employed at a state entity where he has been working as a security guard for three years. Miguel Antonio is married and has three children under his care.

He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that he can buy materials such as zinc sheets and crossbeams in order to maintain the roof of his home, which is in bad condition. Don Miguel Antonio dreams of seeing his house with a good roof because of the upcoming rainy season. He will be able to provide his family with a decent roof because of the assistance that CEPRODEL and Kiva have provided.

loans.use: to buy materials for maintaining his roof.

loans.name: Dedia's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 16 octobre 2012 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madama dédia (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Malgré son âge très avancé 55 ans est une femme très dynamique, elle a une cantine où elle stocke les produits agricoles achetés dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revente soit par détail ou par sac selon le type de produit.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter des sacs d’ognon et de riz respectivement à 10 000 et 13 000 F CFA.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices accroître son épargne d’une par et d’autre part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created on October 16, 2012 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois', this group is composed of women from the same village who share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale businesses.

Ms. Dédia (seated at the far right in the photo with a hand raised) is the featured borrower in the group. Despite her advanced age of 55, she is a very energetic woman. She has a stall where she stocks farm products purchased from the weekly markets, and then she sells  them, either retail or by the sack, depending on the product.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase sacks of onions and rice at 10,000 francs CFA and 13,000 francs CFA, respectively.

She plans on using the profits to grow her savings for one thing and also to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase onions and rice

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en: Ramaz is 44 years old. He lives alone in Khikhani village, in the Marneuli district. Ramaz has requested for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. Ramaz has a coal business. He has his own coal pits, where he produces coal and sells it at the local markets to earn a monthly income. Ramaz has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ramaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Ramaz will renovate his shed and purchase calves. He wants to start farming. After raising the calves, he will sell them at a better price and earn good profit. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting into the same field while another part is for improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shed and purchase calves

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids, who attend school. She lives at her own house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Mercy operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years now. 
A major challenge in her business is disease outbreaks which cause the death of chicks. Mercy dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the Kshs 45,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans for boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Moflah

texts.en:
Moflah is 44 years old, married, and is a father of eleven children who live in Haja, Yemen. He is the sole provider of the family. He is an employee, getting a low salary. He said he faces a difficult situation where his income is not enough to cover his big family needs.

He has a small house and he is well-known in his surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. He intends to renovate his house.

Moflah is requesting a loan of YER 400,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.
