He believes that this loan will positively improve his life. He hopes to be able to provide for his family’s needs and to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon's retail shop is doing very well. He is grateful to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) for extending him financial support which has enabled him to stock his shop. His monthly income has increased to KES 19,500, which he uses to support his family. 

Solomon is requesting a third business loan to buy more stocks of sugar and washing detergents, in bulk. He will use the proceeds from the business to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar and washing detergents, in bulk.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 28-year-old woman from Kisumu, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Osccar, who is employed and supports the family. They don't have any children.

Caroline has been operating a motorbike transport business for the last year and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She will use the anticipated profits to save in order to buy another motorbike for transport.

Her dream is to venture into the transport business fully and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 42-year-old woman. She is conservative and asked her son Basel to appear in the photo in her place. Khitam and her husband have a pigeon house where they raise pigeons to sell. Her family members also have other jobs.

Khitam is requesting a loan to make a bigger pigeon tower home to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to make a bigger pigeon coop

loans.name: Djiba's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 16 octobre 2012 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Djiba (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 33 ans et mère de quatre enfants de deux à seize ans dont un garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits de consommation à longue durée de conservation à savoir l’huile, le savon et les détergents qu’elle achète en gros pour la revente en détail. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter trois paquets de savon à 7 500 F CFA, un bidon de vingt litres d’huile à 17 500 F CFA, sachet de détergent en poudre à 5 000 F CFA.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour la scolarisation de ses enfants d’une part et d’autre part à constituer une épargne assez importante pour prétendre dans le futur à un crédit plus significatif.
texts.en:
This group was created on October 16, 2012, upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of women from the same village who share a strong bond of support and solidarity. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Djiba (sitting at the far right with one hand raised) is the featured borrower for this group. Djiba, age 33, is the married mother of four children aged 2 to 16 years old, one of them a boy.  She sells consumer products with a long shelf life such as oil, soap and detergents. She buys wholesale and sells at retail.  

She will use this new loan to buy 3 boxes of soap for 7,500 F CFA, one 20-liter can of oil for 17,500 F CFA, and a packet of powdered detergent for 5,000 F CFA.

She will use her profits to support her children’s education, and to bolster her savings significantly enough to be able to seek a larger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 packs of soap for 7,500 F CFA, one 20-liter can of oil for 17,500 F CFA, and a packet of powdered detergent for 5,000 F CFA.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widow and mother of six children, four of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a restaurant business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from other clothes-sellers. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Mwanamisi wants to expand her restaurant business, purchasing furniture and foodstuff for her business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: she wants to expand her restaurant business, purchasing furniture and foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is a 22-years-old divorced lady. She lives at her parent's house. She is a university student majoring in business administration. Now Abeer is applying for an educational loan to pay for her semester fees, in order to get her bachelor degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même village. elle font toute du commerce .Elle on une bonne cohésion sociale.
Aby est la représentante du groupe, née le 04/04/1962 elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons et 3 filles tous majeurs.c'est elle qui a levé sa main sur la photo.Elle fait de la restauration de petit déjeuner dans sa maison ; les villageois aiment ses plats délicieuse qu'ils achètent  tous les matins pour mettre dans leur pain.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter tous les condiments nécessaire pour ses préparations( huile,oignon,petit poids, spaghetti,haricot etc...)
Avec ses bénéfices elle fait ses épargnes dans le banc villageois,elle aide aussi ses enfants dans leurs besoins car c'est elle qui prend en charge totalement la famille.
texts.en:
This group comprises five women living in the same village. They all work in commerce. They have good social cohesion. Aby is the group's representative. She was born on April 4, 1962 and is a widow and a mother of seven children, four boys and three girls, all adults. Aby is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She has a restaurant selling breakfasts out of her house; the villagers like her delicious food that they purchase throughout the morning to put into their bread.

With her loan, she intends to purchase all the condiments necessary for cooking (oil, onions peas, spaghetti, beans, etc…) 

She saves her profits at the 'banc villageois' and helps out her husband and her children too in meeting their needs, since she is the only one who is supporting the family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, black-eyed peas, oil, packaging material, peas, onions, and spaghetti

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Lucy owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lucy has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators.
 
With the KES 30,000 loan, Lucy wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. For the past year, she has operated an open-air food business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. Fatuma's major business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Santos Benedicto

texts.es: Don Santos de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos mayores los cuales ayudan en todo lo relacionado con los cultivos, el es agricultor desde hace varios años sus principales siembras son el maiz, frijol y maicillo, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Santos solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas y para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos, para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and grown children who help with all of the farming duties.

Don Santos has been a farmer for several years and his main crops are corn, beans, and sorghum. As a result of the sales of his harvested crops, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. Don Santos is requesting a loan so that he can buy needed supplies for his crops and improve the land (as shown in the photograph) that he uses for planting. This will enable him to generate more income and provide what his family needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, herbicides, as well as pay for improvements to his land.

loans.name: Maria Asuncionm

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 46 años de edad joven, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse. Ella es madre soltera de 9 hijos los cuales son los únicos que le ayudan con las actividades del campo como ser: poda, limpieza, fertilización y abono. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña y tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo cual ella tiene mucha experiencia y sabe cómo cultivar este producto para su venta. Su terreno lo adquirió gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo que puso para hacer sus metas realidad y sus cultivos están en la misma propiedad donde ella habita por lo cual esto le permite dar a sus cultivos un mejor mantenimiento y cuidado.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café por medio del cual podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus metas son de seguir adelante con sus hijos ya que son los únicos que ayudan con las actividades del campo para poder cumplir sus sueños de sembrar más variedad de productos los cuales generen más ingresos para su familia y ellos puedan seguir estudiando y con el tiempo heredar las tierras que hoy en día trabajan.
texts.en: María, who is 46, is young, perseverant, enterprising and determined to succeed.  She is a single mother of 9, and these children are the only ones who help her with her farming activities such as pruning, cleaning and applying fertiliser and manure.  She has no educational qualifications because her oparents had very little money.  It was they who taught her, from a very young age, to work the land and, having done this for over 15 years, she has gained a great deal of experience and knows how to grow produce for sale.  The effort and hardwork she devoted to realising her ambitions enabled her to purchase her plot of land which adjoins the property where she lives and, therefore, enables her to maintain and look after her crops better.  She is currently seeking help to buy manure and fertiliser for her coffee plants so as to have a healthy crop which she can benefit 100% from.  Her ambitions are to provide for her children, since they are the only ones who help her with her farming activities, to fulfil her dream of cultivating a wider range of crops so as to boost income for the family, to allow them to continue their education and, in time, inherit the land which they now work.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertiliser for her coffee crop

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 16 octobre 2012 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diénabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Mariée, mère de dix enfants âgés de dix sept à un an dont sept garçons. Elle est vendeuse en détail de produits alimentaires : riz, huile de palm, divers condiments et épices.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter deux bidons de vingt litres d’huile de palm à 20 000 F CFA l’un, trois sacs de riz à 13 000 F CFA le sac et divers épices.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille : éducation et santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on October 16, 2012 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois', this group is composed of women from the same village who share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale businesses.

Ms. Diénabou (seated at the far right in the photo with a hand raised) is the featured borrower in the group. She is a married mother of ten children, from 1 to 17 years old, including seven boys. She sells grocery items retail: rice, palm oil, and a variety of condiments and spice.

Her new loan will enable her to purchase two 20-liter containers of palm oil at 20,000 francs CFA each, 3 sacks of rice at 13,000 francs each, and various spices.

With the profits, she plans further supporting her husband in covering family expenses: education and the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice, and various spices

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with ten children, all of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. Sarah has been selling green bananas at retail in the market for the last ten years, working six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to enable her to purchase more bunches of green bananas for sale. She has no other source of income. The main business challenge she is facing includes seasonality and transportation. She would like to start selling green bananas at wholesale, to own a delivery van in order to ease transportation and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT because she did not have to give in monetary collateral in order to access loans. She is renting a house with both electricity and piped water now. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is 45 years old. She lives in the Kobuleti district with her husband and 19-year-old son. Maguli has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business. However, she has not had success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Maguli's family owns a plot of agricultural land, where mandarin and nut trees are grown. The harvested products are sold locally at the markets. Maguli’s husband is an artisan. He works on construction for private orders and earns additional income for the family. 

Maguli has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Maguli has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. 

These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her loan, Maguli will purchase a mini-bus, which her husband will use to transport the local people. This will give the family an opportunity to increase their monthly income. With the increased income, Maguli will be able to provide for her son's education in the future.

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For over two years, she has operated a coconut business, selling from home to her local neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Salim dreams of establishing a wholesale store, selling coconuts in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman with four kids who all attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and together they own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Teresia has operated a business selling ropes for the past 8 years. Her potential clients are mostly dairy farmers. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop selling ropes in the future. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase additional stocks of ropes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support for improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ropes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children. She operates a paraffin business, selling to her neighbors who use her paraffin for cooking and lamps. Fatuma has mentioned that her major business problem is that she lacks enough capital to expand her business. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to purchase paraffin to sell

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en: Fadel is a single man who lives with his family. After earning his bachelor's degree, Fadel started working at a government entity. Now he wants to get a higher degree in the same major to get a better job opportunity. For this reason, he is applying for an educational loan to register in a master's degree program at a university.

loans.use: to register in a master's degree program.

loans.name: Dorfine

texts.en:
This is Dorfine. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She sells sporting goods and is helped by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. 

Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it most. She has paid the installments on time.

Dorfine constantly strives to improve her retail shop, trying to sell more and save more money in order to have a more successful establishment. Dorfine is requesting a loan to buy hockey sticks and medals.

loans.use: to buy hockey sticks and medals.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but without piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past two years, she has operated a green grocery shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocery stores. Pamela dreams of establishing a fruit parlor in the future. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans for improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es:
El Joven Juan Victor  vive en Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable trabajador,  con buenos valores morales  su estado civil es casado con dos personas a su cargo, en edad escolar,  desempeñándose de Higienista en una institución del estado desde hace tres años.

Solicita a CEPRODEL un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para repellar pared de la casa y darle mejor seguridad.

Agradece a KIVA-CEPRODEL por la oportunidad  y la confianza que le otorguen este financiamiento, para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Victor is a young man who lives in Managua, Nicaragua. He is a hardworking and responsible person with good moral values. Juan Victor is married and has two school-age dependents under his care. He has been working as a hygienist at a state institution for three years.

Juan Victor is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement, and to pay for labor. He plans to repair the walls of his house in order to provide better security. Juan Victor is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for this opportunity and the trust they have demonstrated by providing this loan so that he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nerys Abraham

texts.es:
El Señor Nerys es un persona muy luchadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de mariscos desde hace 20 años.
Don Nerys tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y distribuye sus productos a revendedores que lo destruyen en las distintas localidades de la zona.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como: babosa, pancha, camarones, jaiba, etc.
Don Nerys necesita el préstamo para seguir cubriendo la demanda de sus clientes, espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen los clientes a diario.
Don Nerys espera que sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco  el estilo de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. El espera aumentar su negocio con la compra de mas producto y así convertirse en el distribuidor final del  mismo y  así seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que continúen los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en el futuro. 



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Nerys is a very perseverant and responsible person who lives with his 3 children in a town in the South of Honduras.  He has sold seafood for 20 years.  Nerys runs his business from his home and distributes his produce to dealers who redistribute it to various places throughout the region.  He needs the loan to buy more produce such as slugs, banded croaker fish, shrimps, crabs, etc. to meet customer demand.  Her hopes the loan will be very useful for him as he does not have sufficient supplies to meet his customers' daily orders.  Nerys hopes to increase his sales and boost his household income so as to improve his family's lifestyle.  He hopes to expand his business by buying more produce and to make himself the final distributor.  This will enable him to continue to support his children, who are still at school, and to see them grow into good people with better life chances in the future.   



Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy slugs, banded croaker fish, shrimps, crabs, etc. for his business

loans.name: Misalim

texts.en:
Misalim is a married woman with six children, one of whom attends school. For over seven years, she has operated a business selling coconuts from her home. Misalim sells to neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Misalim owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Misalim is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 53-year-old married man with one daughter. He has an unregistered mini-market that provides an income to support his family. 

Fouad is requesting a loan to register his business as well as purchase more food products for his store. He hopes to increase his profits.

loans.use: to register his store and buy more products

loans.name: Dalvis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dalvis, es propietaria de un taller de confección ubicado en su casa en el cual elabora y comercializa prendas de vestir. Se encuentra separada del padre de sus tres hijos, por lo cual ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para generar los ingresos para su familia y su educación. 
Dalvis, requiere con urgencia de la compra de una maquina que le permita reducir los tiempos de producción y cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos. 
Sueña con incrementar su número de maquinas y generar empleos directos.
texts.en:
Dalvis is the owner of a sewing workshop in her home where she makes and sells clothing. She is separated from the father of her three children. For this reason, she must work hard to generate income for her family and for their education.

Dalvis urgently needs to buy a machine so that she can reduce her production time and fulfill her customers’ orders. She dreams of increasing the number of machines and generating jobs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Jose trabajaba en un taller de carpintería donde adquirió mucha experiencia en la elaboración de muebles de madera como sillas, mesas, chineros, roperos etc. Hace un año el estableció su propio negocio en su casa, donde elabora muebles para vender. Ya cuenta con su propia clientela. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar los materiales como madera, pegamento, tornillos, pinturas etc. Para elaborar los muebles. Su objetivo es llegar a ser un fabricante de muebles y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José, 40, is single living in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  José used to work in a carpentry shop wherein he acquired much experience manufacturing wood furniture items like chairs, tables, china cabinet, armoires, etc.  A year ago he set up his business at home where he manufactures furniture to sell.  He has his own established clientele.  

He’s decided to request a 7,000 Lempira loan to buy supplies like wood, glue, screws, paint, etc. to manufacture furniture.  His objective is to become a furniture maker and earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to build furniture.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is a 33-year-old divorced woman who supports her two children by working at a private company and operating a small chicken sales business from home. She has a few chickens, and she sells both chickens and eggs. 

Maysoon is applying for a loan to increase her stock of chickens and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: DOÑA JUANA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE, DESDE HACE YA MAS DE 9 AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL COMO LO SON, POLLAS PONEDORAS, GALLINAS DE PATIO, PATOS, PAVOS Y CERDOS. Y  TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA PLANTACION DE CAFÉ, EL AREA DONDE VIVE ES PROPICIA PARA ESTE TIPO DE ACTIVIDAD COMO TAMBIEN SON MUY COMERCIALIZADOS DICHOS PRODUNCTOS. DOÑA JUANA AGRADECE A KIVA EL APOYO BRINDADO A SU PERSONA YA QUE LE HA AYUDADO A SUPERARSE Y A CRECER EN SU NEGOCIO. TAMBIEN HA SIDO BIEN RESPONSABLE EN SU CREDITO YA QUE HA PAGADO SIEMPRE PUNTUAL, DOÑA JUANA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PALLAS PONEDORAS, CONCENTRADO PARA ANIMALES DE CORRAL Y ABONO QUIMICO Y ORGANICO PARA PLANTAS DE CAFÉ.
texts.en: Juana is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She has been raising animals, such as cocks, hens, backyard chickens, ducks, turkeys and pigs, for the past nine years.  She also raises coffee in the area where she lives and sells these products.  Juana is grateful to Kiva and because it has helped her become successful and grow her business.  She has also been responsible with her loan and has made her payments on time.  Juana is asking for a loan so she can buy hens, feed, fertilizer, and compost for her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marina De La Paz

texts.es: Doña Marina de 61 años de edad se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos en un mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con sus dos hijos en casa del hijo mayor, ella desea acrecentar su negocio pero no tiene suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para tener mas clientela y asi pueda obtener mejores ingresos para tener lo necesario en su hogar sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Marina is 61 years old and sells clothing and shoes at a market near her home.  She covers some of the household expenses with the earnings.  She lives with her two children in her older son’s home.  She wants to grow her business but doesn’t have sufficient capital so is asking for a loan so she can buy what she needs so she can have more customers and be able to increase her income and have what she needs for her household without limits.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 23-year-old business man. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past three years with a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. 

James is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He is glad for the financial support he has been receiving from KADET LTD. 

James will use the loan to open a salon business for his wife, Mary. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and to easily provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and open a salon business for his wife.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi, 28, is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Bibi operates a business selling cereals from home to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale cereals business in the near future. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase wheat, maize, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta, de 57 años de edad , es una mujer luchadora. Tiene 6 hijos pero vive en compañía de su hija Andrea en la casa de material rústico que heredó de su madre. Alberta antes se dedicaba a la agricultura pero ahora que es adulta mayor, se dedica a la venta de  leña , negocio en el cual le va muy bien y no tiene que hacer mucho esfuerzo aunque lo complicado es poder distribuir las leñas  , pero sus hijos y nietos le ayudan en este proceso lo cual la tiene más tranquila.
De la misma manera se siente muy agradecida con sus clientes que  vienen todas las mañanas  a poder  comprar sus rajadas de leña lo que  la motiva a seguir trabajando  para así seguir apoyando a sus hijos  y nietos en algunos de sus gastos.Este es su quinto crédito, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con sus ventas .Alberta invertira los S/.2000 soles en la compra de rajas de Leña .
texts.en:
Alberta is 57 years old and is a very hardworking woman.  She has six children and lives with one of her daughters in a rustic home that she inherited from her mother.  Alberta used to farm, but now that she is elderly, she sells firewood.  This business has been going well for her and she doesn’t have to put forth very much effort, even though delivering the firewood is complicated.  Her children and grandchildren help her with this process so she is more relaxed about it.

By the same manner, she is grateful to her customers who come every morning to buy her firewood, which motivates her to continue working so she can continue to support her children and grandchildren with some of her expenses.  This will be her fifth loan and she is grateful for the financial support and she is committed to making her payments on time.  Alberta will use the 2,000 PEN to buy firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Gina Mabel

texts.es: Gina, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace un año ella decidió establecer su propio negocio en su casa y así estar junto a sus hijos. El negocio es una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, productos de aseo y limpieza, pan, huevos, sal etc. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras para surtir de más productos alimenticios para vender en su pulpería, como ser, granos básicos, pan, sal, azúcar y huevos. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para mejorar su economía y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gina, 36, is a single mother of two children; she lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  A year ago she decided to start her own business at home so she could be with her children.  Her business is a grocery store where she sells basic staple items like basic grains, lard, sugar, cleaning supplies, bread, eggs, salt, etc.

She’s requesting a 7,000 Lempira loan to stock up on more food items like basic grains, bread, salt, sugar and eggs for her grocery store.  Her goal is to make the business grow to improve her economy and help her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 20-year-old single lady. She has four siblings, and they all live with their parents. Mai is attending university, earning her Bachelor's degree in Educational Practices. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for next semester's school fees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 38, is married and has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Alice has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the poultry business is seasonality.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith nació en la ciudad de Colorado y vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú).  
  
Judith tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de siete años. Ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, carne, verduras y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Judith was born in the city of Colorado but lives in the city of Salvación.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province which is in Madre de Dios Department, Peru).

Judith is 29-years-old and is in a common law relationship; she has a seven-year-old son.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising mother who supports her family and her main economic activity is selling food.  She has a small restaurant where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She’s been in business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

She belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” (Manu’s Little Treasures) and on this occasion needs the loan to buy supplies like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, meat, vegetables and others.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 35-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son Haytham to appear in the photo in her place.  

Layla's husband is a teacher, and she is a housewife looking after her five children. Her oldest son, Haytham, has already become a university student majoring in marketing. Layla is applying for an educational loan to pay for her son’s university fees to support him in his education.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier de 43 años de edad es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales adora y por quienes trabaja día a día con el ánimo de brindarles educación, alimento y un buen hogar. Se dedica a la siembra de café, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar y con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia. Debido a la ola invernal, sus cultivos se han visto afectados. Por lo cual Javier necesita invertir en la compra de semilla, riegos y abonos que le permitan mejorar su cosecha. Como no cuenta con recursos propios recurre a la solicitud de un crédito, debido a que esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Javier is 43 years old and the father of three children who he adores. For this reason, he works enthusiastically day after day to provide them with education, food, and a good home.

Javier grows coffee, a trade that he learned as part of a family tradition. Now he is able to help his family get ahead. His crops have been affected by the rainy season, so Javier needs to invest in the purchase seeds and compost, as well as pay for irrigation so that he can improve his harvest. He does not have resources of his own, so he has come to request a loan. This business is the only source of income by which he can sustain his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and to pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi is 27 years old. He lives in a small village in the Khelvachauri District with his wife. Genadi requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the small salary earned by Genadi working as the driver of a cargo truck. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Genadi requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Genadi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his loan, Genadi will renovate his minibus and work on a mini-bus line. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate his minibus and work on his minibus line.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old mother from a market called Cross Over in Kisumu City. She support three people in her family. Her husband, Otieno, is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children aged eight years and four months.

Mercy has been operating a beauty salon business for the last one and a half years, and she makes a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase items like a dryer, weaves, and stools. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Mercy dreams of opening a big outlet and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase more weaves, a dryer, and stools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Goyib

texts.ru: Гойиб пожилой мужчина в возрасте 50 лет. Он женат, но по состоянию здоровья он не имеет детей. Но несмотря на это, Гоиб со своей женой живут счастливо и дружно, в их семье есть полное взаимопонимание. Так как в их семье нет детей, которые могли бы ухаживать за ними и обеспечивать, им приходится самим зарабатывать на жизнь. Поэтому они занимаются собственным бизнесом, который приносит им доход на проживание. Гоиб занимается дехканством, выращиванием картофеля и пшеницы. В прошлый сезон он  получил  хорошую прибыль от сбора урожая и на полученную прибыль он смог купить себе трактор для повышения эффективности работы. А также в свободное время Гоиб предоставляет услуги тракториста, работает на земле у своих соседей  и получает деньги за предоставленную услугу. Это приносит ему дополнительный доход. Сейчас начинается новый сезон посева и Гоиб планирует увеличить объём своего урожая (картофеля и пшеницы), после чего  получить хороший приемлемый доход для  лучшего проживания. Для того, чтобы закупить достаточное количество семян и удобрений, ему необходима большая сумма денег, поэтому Гоиб обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, для закупа необходимого инвентаря для посева урожая. Он надеется на поддержку и заранее благодарит Арванд.
texts.en:
Goyib is an older man of 50 years. He is married, but for health reasons does not have children. But despite this, Goyib and his wife live happily and harmoniously together, and in their family they have a full mutual understanding. Since they have no children who would take care of and support them, they are left to make a living for themselves. Therefore, they are engaged in their own business that brings them income to live. Goyib works in dekhan farming, growing potatoes and wheat. 

This past season, he received a good profit from the harvest and he was able to buy a tractor with the profits to improve work performance. In his spare time, Goyib provides tractor services, working on the land for his neighbors and gets paid for these services. This brings him additional income. 

Now the new planting season is beginning and Goyib is planning to increase his crops (wheat and potatoes) and then to get a good, acceptable income for better living conditions. In order to purchase a sufficient quantity of seed and fertilizer a large sum of money is needed, so Goyib turned to Arvand and wants to get a loan for the purchase of necessary equipment for planting the crops. He hopes for the support and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es: Doma Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol con su esposo tiebne varios años de realizar dicha actividad cuando ya esta lista su cosecha sale a comercializarlos a los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de reidencia asi como muestra la fotografia y con las ganancias que obtiene logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar. doña maria solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc para el cultivo de granos básicos para así hacer mas ventas y obtener mas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
María lives in her own house with her husband and two children who are minors.  She and her husband work growing corn and beans.  She’s been doing this for several years and when the harvest is ready she heads out to the markets near her place of residence to sell them like shown in the photo.  She uses profits earned to cover household expenses.

María’s requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. to grow basic grains in order to increase sales and earn more profits to give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Don Faustino de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa quien es ama de casa y su hijo que estudia. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Fustino solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, etc. para poder aumentar su numero de ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Faustino, 43, lives with his wife who is a housewife and their son who is a student.  He has worked growing corn and sorghum for several years.  With his sales he’s able to cover some of his household expenses.  

Faustino is asking for a loan to buy some farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, etc. to increase sales and earn higher profits to provide unlimited better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura en la producción de plátano, maíz y frijoles para consumo y venta, además a realizado trabajos de jornal. Ahora el esta asociado a un grupo de campesinos donde le alquilan terreno para realizar los cultivos de plátano maíz y frijoles y vender. El ha obtenido siete ciclos de prestamos en ODEF con el actual que es por 4,000 Lempiras y los utilizara en la compra de fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz y plátano. Su sueño  es mejorar su vivienda para vivir mejor con su familia y que su cultivo mejore para obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Jorge, 56, and his wife live in a common law relationship; they have three children and live in a village in Choloma Municipality, Cortes.  He’s spent his entire life in agriculture growing bananas, corn and beans both for family consumption and to sell.  He also works as a day laborer.  He’s currently associated with a group of farmers that lease land to grow corn and beans to sell.

He’s had seven loan cycles with ODEF and the current one is for 4,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fertilizer for his corn and banana crop maintenance.  His dream is to make some home improvements to live better with his family and that his harvests improve in order to earn profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his banana and corn crops.

loans.name: Dilcia

texts.es:
La señora  Dilcia de 33 años de edad es casada, vive con sus dos  hijos y su esposo en una casa que rentan donde un familiar  se dedica desde hace 10 años.
Doña Dilcia su negocio es la venta abarrotería, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en su negocio.
Doña Dilcia es una mujer emprendedora que a demás de su negocio en el mercado vende tamales y sopas los fines de semana.
Doña Dilcia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, detergentes, escobas, salsas, pastas, salsas, leches, aguas, etc. desea invertir más en su negocio por que sus clientes le están demandando cada día más productos que  no tiene en su negocio.
Doña Dilcia con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar su negocio y por ende obtener mejores ganancias que ayudaran a sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño es tener su propia casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Dilcia, 33, is married living with her two children and her husband in a house they rent from a family member.  For the last ten years, Dilcia has been in the grocery business.  Her customers are friends and people who visit her store daily.  Dilcia’s an enterprising woman who in addition to her grocery store also sells tamales and soup on the weekend.

Dilcia is asking for a loan to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, detergent, brooms, sauces, pastas, milk, water, etc. to invest more in her store because her customers demand more products every day that she does not stock in her store.

With the loan’s support, Dilcia hopes to improve her business and as a result earn higher profits that will help her move her family forward.  Her dream is to own a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2013.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором женщина с доброй душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она много лет жила бедно, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ. Много лет она занималась услугой портнихи, но так как ее доход маленький, она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей женской одежды и тканей. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить женскую одежду и тканей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000  сомони для покупки женской одежды и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a woman with a good heart and lovely thoughts. She is married and is raising four children. For many years, she has lived in poverty as her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and they are not able to provide their children with all the necessary means. Year after year, the children require more support. 

For many years, she was engaged in services as a dressmaker, but because her income is small, she decided to organize a business buying and selling women's clothing and fabrics. She has long sought for help and finally found out about the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in this course and received a lot of positivity for herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate. Now, she is ready to start a business, but she does not have the money to buy women's clothing and fabrics. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy women's clothing and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Sawa Yakola Development Group

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old, widowed, and has four children. She has also been taking care of two orphans for one year. She knits and has a small boutique where sells the sweaters. She sells some of her sweaters to a local school. She also has a small room that she rents out to get additional income.

Florence is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase knitting wool. Her major challenge is the lack of electrical sewing and knitting machines, which would enable her make more sweaters faster and neater .She hopes to buy these machines in the future if more funding is made available. Her dream is to open up a knitting school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase knitting wool

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en: Mkambe is a hardworking woman who is trying her best to uplift her family. She used her previous loan to boost her business. Mkambe is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy eight goats to sell to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase eight goats.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 23 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband works in the blacksmith business. While taking care of her children at home Maryam sells blankets to friends and neighbors.  By the word of mouth she is getting more and more known. 

Maryam is requesting a youth loan, which she will use to buy new bed covers for summer use to add to the variety of her products.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers for summer use

loans.name: Luz Nancy

texts.es:
Luz de 41 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos. Por su difícil condición económica ha laborado en innumerables trabajos con el fin de sacar su familia adelante y brindarle un mejor futuro. 
En la actualidad, desea montar su propio negocio; una cafetería que están terminando de construir en una IPS, de la ciudad de Medellín. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de  un calentador, greca, utensilios y surtido. 
Su mayor deseo es poder brindarles a sus dos hijos mejores condiciones de vida y la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Luz is a 41-year-old mother who heads her family of two children. Due to her difficult economic situation, she has had to work a number of jobs so that she can help her family move forward and provide them a better future.

At the moment, Luz wants to establish her own business – a cafeteria that has finished construction at a health institution in the city of Medellín. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of a food warmer, a coffee dispenser, utensils, and inventory. Her greatest wish is to provide her two children with better living conditions and the opportunity to enroll at the university.

loans.use: to buy a food warmer, a coffee dispenser, utensils, and inventory.

loans.name: Edna Amarilis

texts.es: Edna, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Doña Edna lleva 6 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de comida en su casa. Vende desayunos, almuerzos, cenas y comidas rápidas. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar un cuarto préstamo en ODEF por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar materia prima como carnes, vegetales, manteca, condimentos y otros materiales para la elaboración de comidas. Su objetivo es que el negocio crezca y de los ingresos poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edna, 53, is married and has three children; she lives in a suburban neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.  Edna has had her own home-based food preparation business for six years.  She sells breakfasts, lunches, dinners and fast-food.  

She’s decided currently to request her fourth ODEF loan for 15,000 Lempiras to buy raw materials like meats, vegetables, lard, condiments and other ingredients needed to prepare the food.  Her goal is that her business grows and be able to use income to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Doña Agustina, tiene 60 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 6 años que doña Agustina inicio su propio negocio. Vende mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, además vende zapatos y sandalias. El negocio lo tiene en un mercado local. Lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamos con ODEF con el actual el cual es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de ropa y sandalias para surtir su negocio. La meta que se ha planteado es hacer crecer el negocio y lograr que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Agustina, 60, is married and has two children; she lives in a village belonging to Choloma Municipality, Cortes.  Agustina started her own business six years ago.  She sells merchandise like clothes for women, men and children and also sells shoes and sandals.  Her business is located in a local market.

She’s had four ODEF loan cycles land the current one is for 10,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy clothes and sandals to stock her business.  The goal she’s set is to make the business grow and to succeed in having her children study.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза молодая энергичная и позитивная девушка. С детства она очень любила шить платья своим куклам. Повзрослев, она научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Она очень умелая портниха и шьет красивые одежды. Она теперь уверена в свое мастерство и хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она составила свой бизнес план, проанализировала рынок и готова начать бизнес. Однако у нее нет денег для покупки швейной машинки, которая является основой ее нового бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is an energetic and positive young woman. Since childhood, she has loved very much to sew dresses for her dolls. Growing up, she learned at the dressmaker's how to sew women's clothing. She is a very skilled seamstress and sews beautiful clothing. She is now confident in her skills and wants to start a business sewing women's clothes. 

She was trained in the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She put together her own business plan, analyzed the market, and is ready to start her business. However, she has no money to purchase a sewing machine which is the basis of her new business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en una colonia suburbana del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 18 años de haber establecido su propio taller de tapizado de muebles, asientos y monturas. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y tiene buena clientela. El esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar cuero, cuerina, telas, remaches, pegamento y otros para tapizar muebles. Tiene como meta ayudar a que su hijo se gradúe y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco, 62, is married and has a son; he lives with his family in a suburban neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.  Eighteen years ago he started his furniture, sofa and saddle upholstery business.  His shop is at home and he has a good clientele.

He’s asking for his second loan for 10,000 Lempiras he’ll use to buy leather, faux leather, fabric, studs, glue and other furniture upholstery supplies.  His goal is to help his son graduate and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy upholstery supplies.

loans.name: Ashurqul

texts.ru: Ашуркул житель района Джиликуль, расположенный в южной части Хатлонской области. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве (это индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи). Сам Ашуркул занимается растениеводством. Он арендует земельный участок, в котором выращивает рис. Он занимается этим делом уже 5 лет. Сейчас Ашуркул очень нуждается в кредите для обработки земли. Он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая риса. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая Ашуркул хочет улучшить условия проживания - провести ремонт в доме, а также расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Ashurqul is a resident of the Jilikul region, located in the southern part of the Khatlon district. He is 27 years old. He is married and has one small child. His wife works in a dekhan farm (this is an individual or collective private enterprise where they mainly grow cotton, wheat, and vegetables). Ashurqul himself is engaged in agriculture. He rents a plot of land on which he grows rice. He has been in this business for five years. 

Now Ashurqul very much needs a loan for preparing the land. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for a rice crop. Ashurqul wants to use the profit from selling the crop to improve his living conditions - to carry out repairs on his home, as well as to expand his operations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for a rice crop

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon is a 42-year-old mother of two boys and two girls. Maysoon and her husband support the family with what they make at their food market. Maysoon is applying for a loan to buy more food products and detergents to sell at the store. She wants to add some variety at the store to cover the neighborhood’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more food products and detergents to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She does not look after any additional family members. Rose has been selling charcoal on a wholesale and retail basis in the market and hiring out tents for the last twenty years, working five days a week. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX to enable her purchase more bags of  charcoal and chairs for hiring out. She also decorates venues for weddings and parties to earn more income. Her main business challenges include a having small capital base. She would like to get more tents and chairs and to provide employment for the youth in her community. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital for her business. She is renting a house without both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and plastic chairs for hiring out.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 27-year-old man who recently got married and started his own family. He has a home products store where he sells mostly kitchen ware and other home decor. Omar is applying for a youth loan to buy more home products with different designs to satisfy his customers’ tastes.

loans.use: to buy more home products with different designs for his store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda,y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ha podido reponerse y seguir adelante,  vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos,una de sus nueras y sus nietos.Francisca era la ama de casa común, pero a raíz de la muerte de su esposo, decidió poner un negocio y es así como empezó con la venta de las bebidas gasificadas, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo, se inicio en esta actividad sola, viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para que pueda solventar sus gastos, al inicio le fue complicado ya que no tenia conocimiento de cómo manejar un negocio, pero gracias a Dios y al empeño que puso, pudo salir adelante y ahora su negocio es estable. Siempre positiva, Francisca busca mejorar su nivel de vida y con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de cervezas piensa en abrir otro negocio dedicado a la venta de salchipapas. Este es el primer crédito de Kiva por esta razón agradece el apoyo económico recibido,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.700.00 soles comprará bebidas gasificadas tales como cervezas, gaseosas y agua mineral.
texts.en:
Francisca, 54, is a widow.  Thanks to her children’s support she’s been able to recover and continue forward.  She lives in her own house with her children, a daughter-in-law and her grandchildren.  

Francisca used to be a mere housewife but as a result of her husband’s death she decided to open a business and this is how she started selling carbonated soft-drinks.  She works from home.  She started the business on her own seeing the need to generate income of her own to cover her expenses.  At first, it was difficult because she didn’t know how to run a business but thanks to God and the effort she put into it she was able to move forward and now the business is stable.

Always positive, Francisca is looking to improve her standard of living and with profits earned from beer sales plans to open another business selling ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes].

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the economic support provided; she also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 700 soles to buy carbonated drinks like beer, soft-drinks and mineral water.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Ignacia Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Ignacia, tiene 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella tiene 6 años de haber establecido su negocio de pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, golosinas, embutidos, refrescos, jugos, azúcar, huevos, sal, manteca y otros. Ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo que es por 13,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar granos básicos, churros, refrescos, azúcar, embutidos etc. Su meta es mejorar el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y comprar otra casa.
texts.en:
Ignacia, 48, is married and has three children; she lives in a village in Choloma Municipality, Cortes.  She opened her grocery store six years ago where she sells basic grains, snacks, canned goods, soft-drinks, juices, sugar, eggs, salt, lard, etc.  She’s kept her business stable thanks to investing several loans.

She’s currently asking for her fourth cycle that’s for 13,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, sugar, canned goods, etc.  Her goal is to improve the business in order to help with her children’s schooling and to buy another house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.ru: Курбону 49 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Курбон со своей семьей проживает в районе Джиликуль в южной части страны. Старший сын находится на заработках за пределами страны. Остальные дети помогают отцу в его деятельности. Курбон занимается растениеводством. Он арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает рис. Курбон нуждается в кредите. Он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и топлива для обработки земли. Курбон хочет получить богатый урожай риса и за счет его продажи женить своего младшего сына.
texts.en:
Qurbon is 49 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Qurbon resides with his family in the Jilikul region in the southern part of the country. His older son is earning money outside of the country. The other children help their father in his activities. 

Qurbon is engaged in agriculture. He rents a plot of land on which he grows rice. Qurbon is in need of a loan. He is asking for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel for preparing the land. 

Qurbon wants to get a good rice crop and with the profit to put on a marriage ceremony for his younger son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel for preparing the land

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 49-year-old father of seven sons and daughters. For security reasons, Naser asked his oldest son to appear in the photo in his place. Naser has a small restaurant where he makes and sells traditional Arabic breakfast and dinner foods like hummus, falafel, and other snacks. He is applying for a loan to buy a new tool that will help him prepare the basic ingredients he needs.

loans.use: to purchase a tool to help him prepare basic ingredients for his restaurant.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
This is Damaris. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She sells food, helped by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for sale. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with, and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments in time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to improve her establishment. Damaris is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has no children yet. To help in improving their living conditions, she started selling a few types of cleaning products and food products at home, basically to neighbors. 

Now, Maryam is applying for a youth loan to enhance her business and sell additional, basic food products and ingredients.

loans.use: to sell additional, basic food products and ingredients.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha operates a food making business, making food products like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing food stuffs as her major challenge. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Juana Marta

texts.es: Juana de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Juana tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, lives with her life companion and their children in a house of her own.  She works growing corn and beans.  She’s been working in agriculture for several years and has gained much experience that leads her to obtain the best harvests.  She sells her crops in places adjacent to her community and has a large clientele that prefers her because of her quality, good prices and above all, good service.

She needs to invest which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  Juana has good payment references from acquaintances and she’s very responsible.  She assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan in the established time frame while at the same time is confident that she’ll provide economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Manuchar

texts.en:
Manuchar is 35 years old. He lives in a small village in the Terjola District with his wife and two children. Manuchar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow maize and sell it locally. Their income is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manuchar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Manuchar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this loan, Manuchar will open a Georgian bread bakery. He will purchase all the needed equipment for building a bakery near his house. He hopes the business will be profitable because the location is very well populated. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of Manuchar's family.

loans.use: to open a Georgian bread bakery.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is still selling motorcycle spare parts, and the business is doing very well. He is requesting a second business loan to purchase more bicycle and motorcycle spare parts for sale. He plans to use the proceeds from the business to invest in his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is still doing his business of selling spare parts. He now earns a monthly income of KES 15,200 from his business. 

He is applying for his third business loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). 

Raphael plans to use the loan to purchase more spare parts to sell. He will use the proceeds from the business to invest in his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 61-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Before her husband retired, she started a small business at home to help in supporting the family by selling some food and snacks. 

Huda applied for this loan in order to improve her profits by enclosing her terrace and turning it into a small food store. She also wants to purchase more basic food products for sale.

loans.use: to enclose her terrace and turn it into a small food store and to purchase basic food products for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria, tiene  26 años, casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares y también al servicio de un café internet que funcionan en la misma tienda,   este préstamo lo usara para la compra de accesorios de celulares  para surtir su tienda   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Gloria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorio,   la Sra. Gloria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Gloria, 26, is married and has a five-year-old son.  She works selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories.  She also has an Internet café operating in her store’s space.  

She will use this loan to buy mobile phone accessories to stock her store so that she can offer better customer service thus increasing her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  

Gloria will use profits to continue buying accessories.  Gloria is a very hardworking woman who feels happy because of the opportunity offered since this is the only activity she has with which to support herself.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Linder

texts.en:
Linder is 27 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Kisumu City. Her husband is a businessman. She is an interior designer, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Linder is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase a modern sawing machine to make her work easier and faster. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to expandher business to become stable and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a modern sawing  machine

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 20-year-old single lady. She has two brothers and two sisters. Hanan is a university student majoring in Mathematics. She wants to become a teacher after graduation. Now she is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university costs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 26 years old, is a single mother of one, staying at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Jane has operated a beauty salon business. She operates from home, whereby neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to accommodate more customers in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Jane wants to purchase a hair drier machine for her business. She decided to join to Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair drier machine for her business.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 30-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Simon, who works at an engineering firm and also provides for the family. They have two children who are nine and six years old.

She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been in for the last ten years. She comfortably makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 

Pamela has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase bales of secondhand clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in her business.

Her dream is to become a stable business lady and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is married and has nine children who attend school. He operates a goat selling business, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. He faces major challenges of seasonality and transport in his business.

Baya is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more goats to sell. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de dix  femmes qui sont majoritairement marées dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Djoni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités, des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de riz et des condiments (aubergine, tomates, sel et des échalotes).
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nassa (2eme femme assise à gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de céréales  dans le village de Djoni et ses environs. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50kg de riz. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Djoni à une clientèle composée des hommes et  de femmes. Madame Nassa  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge de la famille et  l’entretien des enfants. Son objectif est de pérenniser son activité et continuer le partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso.
NB : Bintou  ne se figure pas sur  la photo car elle était à un décès.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of ten women who are for the most part married in polygamous families. The women average 34 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Djoni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses involving rice and condiments (eggplant, tomatoes, salt, and shallots).
