With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Nassa (the second woman seated from the left in the photo) is a major seller of grains in and around the village of Djoni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of rice. Sales are made in cash or on credit in the village of Djoni to a customer base composed of men and women. 

Ms. Nassa plans on making an average monthly profit of 13,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover family expenses and care for the children. Her goal is to make her business sustainable and to continue in the Soro Yiriwaso partnership. 

Note: Bintou does not appear in the photo because of a death.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She works selling goat meat. Fatuma's greatest business challenges are seasonality and stiff competition from other operators. She lives with her family in a rented house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is 28 years old. He is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Kamal has had a grocery store for more than eight years and his business has been growing little by little, as he offers good prices and gives good service to his customers. 

He is asking for a youth loan of YER 200,000 to purchase grocery products for his business. He hopes that this loan will increase the goods displayed and, thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo is married with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after any additional family members. For the past one-and-a-half years, Victo has operated a retail shop from her home. She and works six days a week and earns additional income selling raw food. Victo's main business challenge is floods she experiences during the rainy season. She rents a house with electricity and no running water and her monthly expenses include rent, feeding her family, and school fees. Victo joined MCDT for more support to run her business.

Victo is requesting a 1,200,000 UGX loan to purchase rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene, saucepans and plates to sell. In the future, she would like to accumulate profits to enable her buy land and move out of the low-lying area.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene, saucepans and plates to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has four children. For the past eight years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

Luvuno is requesting a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Andjiguignèna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Andjiguignèna est composé de six  femmes qui sont à moitié polygames.  Elles ont en moyenne 23 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Djoni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments : aubergine, tomates, sel, feuilles de baobab et des plantes comestibles.
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (2ème femme debout  de la gauche vers  la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments  dans le village de Djoni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50kg de sel de cuisine auprès des grossistes de la place.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Djoni   à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Andjiguignèna is composed of six women, of whom half are polygamous. The women average 23 years of age and three children each. They all live in the village of Djoni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses involving condiments: eggplant, tomatoes, salt, baobab leaves, and edible plants.

With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Fatoumata (the second woman standing from the left in the photo) is a major seller of condiments in and around the village of Djoni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of table salt from local wholesalers. Sales are made in cash or on credit in the village of Djoni to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

Ms. Fatoumata plans on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase her working capital and to cover certain family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase table salt

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 39 years old and is a married man with seven children. He lives in Hajah, Yemen.  Hassan is a very responsible father who puts his family first. He is a teacher in a primary school and is dedicated to seeing his students become effective and successful members of society. Though his salary is not enough to cover all his family's living expenses, Hassan has refused to change his career. His faith is that teaching is more than getting a salary in the end of each month. Hassan has managed to buy a very small piece of land where he intends to build a small house for his family.

Hassan is requesting a 300,000 YER loan from AMB to buy construction supplies. He hopes that Kiva investors will finance his loan so that he can achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a house for his family

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is 34 years old, married to Patrick, and the mother of three children. For the past year and a half, she has sold second-hand clothes. Truphosa earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Truphosa is requesting a loan to pay school fees for one of her children. This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. In the future, Truphosa wants to open another boutique.

loans.use: to pay school fees for one of her children

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguissèmè est composé de neuf femmes qui sont majoritairement mariées dans les familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Djoni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de tabac, sel, et du riz. Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djenebadjan  (1ere femme assise a gauche au debout du rang sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de riz  dans le village de Djoni  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kg de riz.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Djoni en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et femmes. Madame Djenebadjan compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants..
texts.en:
The group Djiguissèmè is composed of nine women who are for the most part married in polygamous families. The women average 28 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Djoni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses involving tobacco, salt, and rice. 

With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Djenebadjan (the first woman seated from the left in the photo) is a major seller of rice in and around the village of Djoni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 kg of rice. Sales are made in cash or on credit by going door to door in the village of Djoni. Her customer base is composed  of men and women. 

Ms. Djenebadjan plans on making an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and to ensure the children are cared for.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has six children.  She specializes in selling cloth in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for four years. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba is requesting a loan, which she will use to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cloth. In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of cloth

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells palm oil in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a divorcee with 4 children, Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of palm fruit, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: To purchase an increased amount of palm fruit

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
 
Fortunata tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras, comestibles y carnes, ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Pilcopata donde expende sus productos como carne de pollo, arroz, azúcar, cebolla, zanahorias, papas, azúcar y otras cosas más.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le cuesta más barato.
texts.en:
Fortunata was born in the city of Pilcopata and still lives there. The city of Pilcopata is located in the District of Kosñipata, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Fortunata is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has five children. Her main business activity is selling vegetables, food products, and meats. She has a vending stall at one of the main markets in the city of Pilcopata where she offers her products such as chicken, rice, sugar, onions, carrots, potatoes, sugar, and many other items. Fortunata has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work. She is an enterprising and hardworking individual who is a member of the Communal Bank “Paititi”.

Fortunata is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise, such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar in bulk, at a much lower cost.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.ru:
Ованесу 54 года. Он живет с женой и с отцом пенсионером в городе Капан. У Ованеса две дочери, обе замужем и живут отдельно от родителей со своими семьями. Ованес военный и работает в Вооруженных Силах Армении. 
В свободное от работы время Ованес занимается сельским хозяйством и птицеводством. У него есть земельный участок и фруктовый сад где выращивает овощи и фрукты. У Оганеса большой курятник рядом с домом и там он держит своих кур, гусей и уток. Сельскохозяйственные продукты Ованес продает скупщикам прямо из своего дома,что более удобнее чем продавать их на рынке. 
В хозяйстве ему очень помогает его жена , которая с большим удовольствием заботится о птицах. Как она говорит , ухаживать за птицами не легко и надо знать особенности птицеводства и надо просто любить это дело. 
Оганес решил разширить свое птицеводство и особенно он хочет умножить каличество уток и гусей. По ему Ованесу нужен кредит на сумму 350,000 Армянских драм для покупки 20 гусей , 20 уток и корма для птиц.
texts.en:
Hovhannes is 54 years old.  He lives with his wife and his retired father in the city of Kapan.  Hovhannes has two daughters, both are married and live separately from their parents with their families.  Hovhannes is a soldier and works in the Armenian Armed Services.

In his free time, Hovhannes works in agriculture and raises poultry.  He has a plot of land and a fruit orchard where he grows vegetables and fruits.  Hovhannes has a big coop next to his house and keeps his chickens, geese and ducks there.   Hovhannes sells his crops to wholesalers right from his house, which is more convenient than selling them at the market.

His wife helps him a lot with the farm, she takes care of the birds with great pleasure.  As she says, it is not easy to take care of birds and you need to know the particulars of raising poultry and love this job.

Hovhannes decided to expand his poultry business and he especially would like to increase the number of ducks and geese.  This is why Hovhannes need a loan of 350,000 Armenian dram for the purchase of 20 geese, 20 ducks and bird feed.

loans.use: to buy 20 geese, 20 ducks and feed for the birds

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is married with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and also looks after two sisters. For the past four years, Jesca  has been selling spices and food at the market. She works seven days a week and sells salad and water to earn additional income. Jesca's main business challenges include seasonality and the lack of enough market to sell her products. She lives at her husband's house and has both electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Jesca  joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans.

Jesca is requesting an 800,000 UGX loan to buy more raw materials to make food and spices. In the future, she would like to accumulate enough profit to enable her to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make food and spices

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз житель района Спитамен, раположенный в северной части страны. Ему 31 год. У него жена и двое сыновей. Он со своей семьей живет у родителей. Отец Абдуазиза занимается перевозкой грузов. Его мать и жена работают преподавателями в средней школе. Абдуазиз намерен открыть новый бизнес и заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. У них имеется одна дойная корова с теленком для молока и кефира. У Абдуазиза есть опыт в разведении скота и он теперь хотел бы сделать на этом свой бизнес. Однако Абдуазиз нуждается вкредите для реализации своей цели. Он просит кредит для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение 120 дней и затем реализовать их на скотном рынке своего района.
texts.en: Abduaziz lives in the Spitamen region located in the northern part of the country.  He is 31 years old.  He has a wife and two sons.  He and his wife live with his parents.  Abduaziz's father transports freight.  His mother and wife work as teachers at the high school.  Abduaziz is determined to start a new business and buy and sell cattle.  They have one milk cow and a calf for milk and yogurt.  Abduaziz has experience raising livestock and he would now like to start his own business doing this.  But Abduaziz needs a loan in order to achieve his goal.  He is asking for a loan to purchase two heads of cattle.  He plans to fatten the livestock for 120 days and the sell it at the regional livestock market.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Efia

texts.en:
Even though Efia grew up in poverty without an education, it has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. She is an entrepreneur selling cooking ingredients in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). Her business has grown substantially since she began 18 years ago, and Elfia uses her income to help her husband raise their six children.

Efia has identified growing demand for her product but cannot meet it due to limited inventory capacity. She will therefore use this loan to purchase more cooking ingredients to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is divorced and has 4 children. After successfully graduating middle school, Adwowa is now an established businesswoman. She sells plastic containers in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 3 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adwowa uses her income to provide for the entire family. Adwowa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to her customers' preferences.

loans.use: To purchase increased amounts of plastic containers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Even though she did not receive any formal education, Elizabeth, a divorced mother of seven, is a successful businesswoman. She sells plastic containers in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast), a business she has been involved in for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. For about four years now, Abena has been selling secondhand clothing and sheets in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). As a divorced mother of five, she uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family.

Abena will use this loan to purchase more clothing and sheets, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use future profits to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and sheets.

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Жуманазару 37 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Его жена не работает. Он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Жуманазар со своей семьей живет в районе Джиликуль, в южной части Таджикистана. У Жуманазар среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством. Он в этой области уже 9 лет. Жуманазар арендует земельный участок и выращивает на нем рис. Сейчас он запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая Жуманазар планирует улучшить условия проживания и провести ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Jumanazar is 37 years old. He has a wife and three children. As his wife does not work, he is the sole breadwinner in the family. 

Jumanazar lives with his family in the Jilikul region, in the southern part of Tajikistan. Jumanazar has a high school education. He is involved in agriculture. He has been in this area for nine years. 

Jumanazar rents a plot of land and grows rice on it. Now, he is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer for land preparation. With the profit from the sale of the crop, Jumanazar plans to improve living conditions and to complete repairs on his home.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer to prepare the land

loans.name: David Stiven

texts.es:
David de 18 años de edad, es un joven visionario y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. Su habilidad para la barbería lo ha convertido en una eminencia en su localidad, por lo cual desea crear su propio negocio y mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
En la actualidad labora como barbero en el municipio de Copacabana, Colombia pero su salario no alcanza si no para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. 
Sueña con ingresar a la universidad y ayudarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para iniciar con su idea de negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un tocador, silla para corte y utensilios como cuchillas, los cuales son elementos fundamentales para iniciar con su actividad.
texts.en:
David, age 18, is a young visionary who has great hopes of getting ahead. His skills as a barber turned him into a prominent figure in his town. For this reason, he wants to start his own business and improve his family’s economic condition.

David currently works as a barber in the town of Copacabana, Colombia. However, his salary is not enough to cover his basic needs. He dreams of enrolling at the university and helping his mother with the household expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can pursue his business idea. The loan will be invested in a barber station, a barber chair, and equipment such as razor blades. These items are essential elements for launching his business.

loans.use: to purchase a barber station, a barber chair, and equipment.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддин житель района Джиликуль, который находится на юге страны. Ему 32 года. У него жена и один ребенок. Жена работает продавщицей в продуктовом магазине. Сам Нуриддин занимается растениеводством в течение 8 лет. Он арендует земельный участок, где выращивает земляной орех. Сейчас Нуриддин нуждается в кредите, чтобы обработать землю. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива. Нуриддин намерен получить хороший урожай арахиса и за счет его продажи расширить торговую деятельность жены.
texts.en:
Nuriddin is an inhabitant of the Jilikul region, which is located in the south of the country. He is 32 years old. He has a wife and one young child. His wife works as a grocery store clerk. Nuriddin himself has been involved in agriculture for eight years. He rents a plot of land where he grows groundnuts. 

Now Nuriddin needs a loan in order to prepare the land. To this end, he applied for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and fuel.

Nuriddin intends to get a good crop of groundnuts and through its sale to expand his wife's trading activities.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Seyran

texts.ru:
61 летний Сейран живет вместе с женой в селе Севкар что в Сюникской области. У него две дочери , которые замужем и живут со своими семьями отдельно от родителей. Сейран по специальности электромеханик, он окончил Капанский горный техникум и работает по своей специальносто более 40 лет. Кроме работы Сейран занимается сельским хозяйством , выращивает овощи и фрукты. Основной доход у Сейрана от сельского хозяйства. Он продает овощи и фрукты от своего огорода в рынках Капана. По сельскому хозяйству Сейрану очень помогает его жена. 
Сейрану нужен кредит для покупки семян, саженцев,удобрения для земельнего участка и диз топлева для трактора.
texts.en:
61 year old Seyran lives with his wife in Sevkar village, in the Syunik province.  He has two daughters who are married and live separately from their parents.  Seyran is an electrician by profession, he finished the Kapan mountain technical school and has worked in his profession for over 40 years.  In addition to his job, Seyran works in agriculture, he grows vegetables and fruits.  Seyran's main income comes from agriculture.  He sells vegetables and fruits from his garden at the Kapan markets.  Seyran's wife helps him with the farm.

Seyran needs a loan for the purchase of seeds, seedlings and fertilizer for his plot and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for land plot and fuel for tractors

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Even though Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, it has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. An entrepreneur for the past two years, Adwowa operates a chop bar (where local dishes are sold) in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast. Her business has enjoyed substantial growth, and she uses her income to help her husband raise their two children.

Adwowa is unable to meet growing demand for her products due to limited inventory capacity, and so will use this loan to purchase more ingredients. With the new resulting profits, she wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.ru:
Вардану 35 лет. Он родился и живет вместе с женой и двумя сыновьями в селе Н.Анд(N.Hand) что в Капанской области. Жена Вардана работает в полиции.
С ранних лет Вардан занимается сельским хозяйством в родном селе. 
У Вардана есть 13 голов крупного рогатого скота и 20 кур. Рядом с домом у его семьи есть так-же участок земли где Вардан сеет зерно, выращивает помидоры, картофель,огурцы,перец и зелень. 
Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Вардан реализует в оптовых рынках города Капан. 
Молоко, сыр,яйца и мясо от его животноводство Вардан продает оптовикам которые прямо из его фермы покупают товары  и перевозят их в Ереван. 
Вардан доволен своей деятельностью и рад, что со своим трудом может содержать семью и помогать родителям пенсионерам. 
Вардан решил умножить количество его скота и нуждается в кредите на сумму 1,000,000 Армянских драм для покупки 3 коров особой породы которые дают большое количество молока в день.
texts.en:
Vardan is 35 years old. He was born in and still lives with his wife and two sons in the village N.Hand in the Kapan district. Vardan's wife works in the police.

From an early age, Vardan has been engaged in farming in his native village. Vardan has 13 heads of cattle and 20 chickens. Next to his family's home is also a plot of land where Vardan sows corn, grows tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, and herbs. 

Vardan sells agricultural products in wholesale markets in the city of Kapan. 

He sells milk, cheese, eggs and meat from his livestock to wholesalers who buy the goods directly from his farm and transport them to Yerevan.

Vardan is pleased with his work and is glad that with his labor he can support his family and help his parents in their retirement. 

Vardan decided to multiply the number of his cattle and needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy three special breed cows that produce a high quantity of milk each day.

loans.use: to buy three special breed cows that produce a lot of milk daily

loans.name: Artur

texts.ru:
Артур  родился и живет  в селе Цав(Tsav) что в  Сюникской области.Артур женат и живет вместе с женой, новорожденным сыном и с родителями. 
Артур с малых лет занимается сельскохозяйством и  имеет в деревне Цав собственный участок  земли, где выращивает овощи. У него есть так-же 4 голов крупного рогатого скота ,20 кур, свиней и овец.
Родители Артура помогают сыну в хозяйстве. Молоко и мясо от животноводство Артур продает в городе Капан и Каджаран, а овощи и фрукты от огорода помогает реализовать на рынках  отец Артура. 
Артур очень любит свою работу несмотря на тяжести и особенности сельского хозяйства. 
Как признался Артур , он очень счастлив что не смотря на трудное экономическое положение в Сюникской области , он и его родители со своим тяжким трудом достойно  содерживают их большую семью. 
Артур просит от Кива кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для покупки 3 телят и уже через год надеется получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Artur was born and still lives in the village of Tsav that is in the Syunik district. Artur is married and lives with his wife, newborn son, and parents.

Artur from a young age has been involved in agriculture and has his own plot of land in Tsav where he grows vegetables. He also has four heads of cattle, 20 chickens, pigs and sheep.

Artur's parents help their son on the farm. Artur sells milk and meat from the livestock in the cities of Kapan and Kajaran, and Artur's father sells vegetables and fruits from the garden in the market. Artur loves his work despite the severity and peculiarities of agriculture. 

As Artur admitted, he is very happy that despite the difficult economic situation in Syunik district, he and his parents with their hard-earned dignity can support their large family. 

Artur is asking for a Kiva loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy three calves and a year later hopes to get a good profit.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Rutilio Antonio

texts.es: Don Rutilio de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el se dedica hacer viajes a las vendedoras del mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia y a las personas que llegan a comprar; tiene mucha clientela pues el maneja con mucha precaucion, su carro es su unica fuente de trabajo y necesita comprar unos respuestos porque con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos, por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar los repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehiculo y seguir trabajando para llevarles el pan de cada dia a su familia y todo lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Rutilio is 34 years old and lives in a home of his own with his two children and his wife.  He provides transportation for people who buy and sell at the market near his home.  He has many customers since he drives very carefully.  His car is his only source of work and he needs to buy some spare parts because he can’t afford to cover the cost with what he earns.  He is asking for this loan to buy spare parts to maintain his vehicle and continue working so he can provide his family with their daily bread and all they need without limitation.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rayan

texts.en: Rayan is 23-year-old single lady. She is one of eight siblings living with their parents in the same house. Rayan is a university student studying child care and behavior. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
A divorced mother of four who did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman who sells maize in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast. Actively involved in this business for about two years, she uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Aba will use this loan to purchase more maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new resulting profits, Aba plans to further diversify the products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: Arman

texts.ru:
Молодой фермер Арман родился в селе Хнацах(Khnatsakh) что в Капанской области.
С 2000 года Арман переехал в город Каджаран и живет там вместе с женой и 4 летним сыном. 
Арман с ранних лет занимается скотоводством в родном селе, сначала помогал отцу а теперь имеет собственное хозяйство. У Армана уже есть 9 коров и 15 овец. 
Мясо и молочные продукты Арман реализует в рынках Капана и Каджарана. Со своим большим скотом Арман справляется сам , его жена занимается воспитанием сына и не может пока помогать мужу по сельскому хозяйству. Арман очень любит родину , особенно свой родной край  и никогда не смотря на трудности он никогда не думал покинуть страну за зарубежными зароботками. Большая мечта Армана иметь много детей и учить их селькому хозяйству и скотоводству. 
Арману нужен кредит для покупки 4 быков, от которых он через год ожидает получить приличную прибыль. Это первая сделка Армана с Кивой и он нодеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество с Кредиторами Кива.
texts.en:
The young farmer Arman was born in the village Khnatsakh that is in the Kapan district. Arman moved to the town of Kadjaran and, since 2000, has lived there with his wife and four-year-old son. 

Arman from an early age has been involved in raising cattle in his native village. At first he helped his father, but now he has his own farm. Arman already has nine cows and 15 sheep.
 
Arman sells meat and dairy products in the markets of Kapan and Kadjaran. Arman manages with his large cattle by himself; his wife is bringing up their son and is not able to help her husband much with the agriculture. 

Arman loves his homeland, especially his native corner and never despite the difficulties has thought to leave the country for work abroad. Arman's big dream is to have many children and to teach the agriculture and animal husbandry. 

Arman needs a loan to buy four young bulls, from which he expects in a year to get a decent profit. This is the first deal Arman has had with Kiva and he hopes for further cooperation with Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: Maria tiene 32 años es conviviente con dos hijos aun menores educando. Tiene dos mototaxis	que da en alquiler actividad que realizar hace 3 años. Maria años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de comida en el mercado Muruhuay de Chosica. La función que cumple en el grupo “LAS PALOMITAS” es de secretaria. Su mayor deseo es tener un puesto de trabajo seguro y propio para dedicarse más tiempo a sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de sus mototaxis. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Maria es la que se encuentra con su hija en brazos.
texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and lives with her two children who are still in school.  She has two motorcycle taxis that she rents out and has been doing this for three years.  Maria decided to sell food some years ago in the Muruhuay de Chosica market.  She serves as the secretary of the LAS PALOMITAS group and her greatest dream is to have a secure job so that she can dedicate more time to her children.  She is asking for this loan to buy tires and maintain her motorcycle taxis.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  She is the one with her children in her arms.

loans.use: to maintain her taxis.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling doughnuts and plastic containers in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years.  Ekua is married and her husband works as a farmer.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, cooking oil, and plastic containers, thus improving her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar,  cooking oil, and plastic containers.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any form of formal education.  This has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.  Currently, Aba sells plastic buckets in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast.  She has been doing so for about 1 year.  As a divorcee with 1 child, Aba uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family.  Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of plastic buckets, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.  Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase plastic buckets to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa de 60 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y dos nietos. Rosa es una mujer que ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de productos de elote como: atol, tamales, elotes cocidos, etc. Por su amabilidad se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas. Doña Rosa ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: elotes, azúcar, sal, agua, aceite, etc. para la elaboración de los tamales y atol y para mejorar la cocina donde los elabora. Espera poder lograr resultados positivos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is 60 years old and lives in a home of her own along with her husband, daughter and two grandchildren.  Rosa is a woman who has worked all her life to get her children ahead.  She makes and sells things out of corn, such as atole, tamales, cooked corn on the cob, etc.  She has earned the trust of many people due to her friendliness.  Rosa is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients such as corn, sugar, salt, water, cooking oil, etc. to make her tamales and atole and to make improvements to the kitchen where she does her cooking.  She expects to have positive results and be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and upgrade her kitchen.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: After graduating from secondary school, Esi decided to set up her own ‘kenkey’ selling business.  Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves.  She prepares her kenkey on her own and sells it in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast.  With over 3 years-worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further.  Unfortunately, she is limited by the lack of funding.  As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty kenkey.  She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a teacher, with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 1 child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty kenkey.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
Pictured here is Brima, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Staff members from various institutions normally come to SMT for loans. With the help of these loans, they can meet certain financial obligations that they could not meet with their salaries alone. At the end of each month, their finance officer deducts their repayments and repays SMT on their behalf.
 
Brima is 34 years old. A native of Benkia village in northern Sierra Leone, he is married to a businesswoman. The couple has five children, three of whom attend primary school. Brima has worked at this company for 10 years now. In addition to his work at the sugar company, he is also a businessman. He has been a businessman for four years now, selling gara clothes (locally dyed clothes). With the help of this loan, he is going to use it to produce a larger quantity of gara clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to produce a larger quantity of gara clothes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling rice, sugar, and soap in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast.  She has been involved in this enterprise for 8 years. Efua is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay for their children’s school fees.  

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice, sugar, and soap.  In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Ohiaba, near Cape Coast.  She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years.  Aba is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works as a farmer.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay for their children’s school fees. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cooking ingredients, thus improving her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to rent farmland and buy supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is widow and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells cosmetics in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics

loans.name: Marta Lucía

texts.es:
Marta tiene 37 años, de los cuales lleva 8 años dedicada al servicio de la confección a terceros. En conjunto con su esposo, luchan para darles a sus 2 hijos educación y mejores condiciones de vida. 
Marta sueña con brindarle a sus hijos una estabilidad económica, por lo cual desea alternar su oficio con la venta de mercancía, razón por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de accesorios y calzado, lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Marta is 37 years old and has been sewing for others for eight years.  She and her husband work to provide her two children an education and improve their living conditions.  Marta dreams of providing her children with financial stability, so she wants to also begin selling other merchandise as well.  She is asking for a loan that will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nongpok Leima Women Group

texts.en:
Nirmala is pictured with her hand raised, and she is the featured borrower for Nongpok Leima Group.  She has a nuclear family with only a boy and a girl. Her husband runs a shop in the main town market and sells essential household supplies. She also helps in running the shop and on the other hand she is engaged in tailoring. She tailors different designs of mosquito net. Although her husband and she hold a graduate degree, there is very little opportunity for filling a job vacancy in the state government. Therefore both of them decided to do what it takes to survive.

Nirmala tailors and sells different types of mosquito nets to the women vendors in the town market and in the city market. She also gets supplies from other tailors; she supplies sewing/tailoring materials to these tailors and pays their wages once the nets are stitched and finished. With the assistance of the other tailors, she can also produce three or four mosquito nets maximum in a day. Her income has increased with time and she makes good sales during the festival season. 

Nirmala equipped herself with the required sewing/tailoring materials and also informs the other tailors before the busy days begin, i.e., the festival season. The demand is high and the supply usually is short if one does not pre-plan because the embroidered mosquito net is used as a special gift on many occasions. Every single house in the state celebrates the festival during this season, so a gift is a must for every household which is a great advantage for business. 

With the profits she also stocks her husband's shops with more variety and also makes her loan repayment successfully. She also joined a local Investment Body wherein one deposits a stipulated amount of money on daily basis and once it is mature, one can get back the amount with interest. Besides this she also joined a group savings with the other group members.

With the Kiva Loan, she will purchase more supplies for tailored mosquito nets and refill stock to sell in the shop. She wants to invest in the shop because she wants to expand the shop in the future.  Her husband is a good businessman and careful with money, therefore she believes that both of them can work hard and be successful in their business. The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving and tailoring. Nirmala says, “Thank You, Kiva”!

loans.use: To purchase sufficient cloth for sewing mosquito nets and stock for shop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old man, he is married and has three children who all go to school. He buys and sells beans, coffee and maize. In addition he also cultivates coffee and gets additional income from that. He wants to use the loan proceeds for purchasing some more cereals. He currently has a challenge of lack of capital.

His dream is to have a large store where he can  dry the cereals, store them, and complete the whole process to the point where he can sell them. In his words he wants to have a "production firm".

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is a married man, aged 48 years; he has five kids, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Wambua operates a farming business, selling farm produce from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a challenge of seasonality; especially during the dry season, his farm produce is affected. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase farm fertilizers and seeds. He dreams of expanding his farm and establishing a grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: John A

texts.en: In the photo is John, a sugar technician in one of the sugar companies in Sierra Leone. A native of Mayessi, the 40-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. John has been working for this company for nine years now. He has requested this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, paint, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, paint, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Pictured here is Mohamed, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. A native of Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone, he is married and has six children. Three of his children are attending primary school, and the others are not of school-going age. 

Mohamed has been on the staff at the company for nine years now. In addition to his work at the company, he is also a businessman – he has been a businessman for ten years now. Currently he is selling dried fish. He is going to use this loan to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
This is a picture of Brima; he works at a sugar company in northern Sierra Leone. The 45-year-old man is married with four children, two in primary school and two in secondary school. He was born in Mabom village, northern Sierra Leone. He has worked in the sugar company for ten years. Apart from his work at the company, he has also been an agriculturist for the past ten years now. 

Brima has requested this loan to buy seeds to plant in his farm. At the end of each month, the finance manager at the company will deduct Brima’s repayment out of his salary and repay SMT/Kiva lenders on his behalf.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant in his farm

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He wants to purchase sterling silver and jade to continue production.

Gabriel has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I remember when I was 17 years old how much I admired the work that my brother was doing, and how he was also succeeding financially. I admired the fact that whereas before he had to go from place to place on his bicycle, he was able to save enough to get a motorcycle. From working in an auto shop, he had started working at a jewelry workshop and was doing well. I told him I wanted to learn, and he helped me get a job at the workshop.

Thanks to the help of the workshop owner, the other artisans, and especially my brother, little by little I learned more and developed my skills. After some years, constant training and a lot of effort, I decided to start my own workshop. Like with every new beginning, it was tough at first and I worked very hard to get ahead. It's been more than 30 years since I got started in handcrafted jewelry. Now is when I most treasure what I enjoy doing, because it has allowed me to bring food to the table and provide my children with an education."

"I never imagined I could receive this kind of help. Many thanks to all of you who help support artisans like me who work hard every day. May God bless you."

Use the link below to view Gabriel's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8680

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver and jade to continue production

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
Fabiana is an artisan in Peru who specializes in handcrafted jewelry made with dried gourds and gemstones. She would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver to expand production.

Fabiana has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"I learned by watching my father at work as well as other artisans in my village. I enjoyed creating my own pieces and eventually I decided to be immersed in the wonderful world of jewelry. When I first started, I crafted small pieces with simple designs to gain practice and be able to earn and save enough to buy my own materials and tools. I began to work alongside my parents and relatives in 2001 but, now that I have my own family, I decided to become independent so that I could provide for them. I'm motivated by a desire to highlight women's beauty and personality through my designs and creations. I have the best job in the world and I give it my all: my patience, my love and my hard work. This art form is a way to express my ideas and the love that we feel toward it."

"Thank you all for taking part in this microcredit. It's of great support because it will allow us to craft more jewelry, which will increase our sales and in so doing allow us to continue developing as artisans and as a family business. Thanks to this, I will be able to provide for my children's future, so they may have the opportunities I didn't have. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Fabiana's gourd and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7483

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sterling silver to expand production

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Meet Alpha, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. Staff members from various institutions normally come to SMT for loans. With the help of these loans, they can meet certain financial constraints that they could not meet, left with their salaries alone. And at the end of each month, their finance officer will deduct their repayments and repay SMT on their behalf. 

Alpha is a native of Bankia, a village in northern Sierra Leone. He is age 40, married to a businesswoman, and they have eight children – four in primary school and four in secondary. 

Alpha has been on staff at this sugar company for ten years now. In addition to his work at the company, Alpha is also a businessman. He sells gara cloth (locally dyed cloth). He has been doing business for six years now. With this loan, Alpha is going to produce a large quantity of gara cloth to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to produce a large quantity of gara cloth (locally dyed cloth) to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver and jade to increase production.

Pedro has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"When I was 20, I began working in a silver workshop and my passion for making handcrafted jewelry was born. I specialized in engraving silver and have had my own workshop since 1980; it's a simple place, but I have all the tools and space I need to work. We are very grateful for this wonderful opportunity you are giving me and my artisan community in Guatemala."

"Thank you for supporting artisans from my country. This microcredit offers me the opportunity to continue crafting my jewelry. A big hug to you all - my friends!"

Use the link below to view Pedro's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8193

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sterling silver and jade to increase production

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet Abdul, a staff member at one of the sugar-producing companies in Sierra Leone. The 25-year-old is married with one child. He was born in a village called Mamuntha in northern Sierra Leone. 

Abdul has worked for the sugar company for five years. In addition to this, he is also a businessman.  He has been in business for five years, and he sells rice. With this loan, he is going to buy rice in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.name: L' Espoir 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Charite est le coordinatrice de son groupe L'Espoir 4, 5 & 6. Elle es une commercant. tous les membres de ce groupe vivent dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Charite a dirigé son commerce pendant 5 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Elle était une etudiant.

Charite voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers (cosmetiques, chaussures, vetements). Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce de produit divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme cosmetiques, chabon, etc. Elle dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Charite is the coordinator of her group L'Espoir 4, 5 & 6. She is a merchant. All the members of this group live in the DE BOR DE MER region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Charite has been running her business for five years. Before starting it, she was a student.

Charite would like to use this loan to invest in a variety of products (cosmetics, shoes, clothing). She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business for general merchandise. Other active members have need of a loan for businesses involving cosmetics, charcoal, etc.  She says that her main challenge is to become a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase various goods (clothing, cosmetic, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
This loan will help Frank grow his basil farming and distributing business.

Frank, a retired veteran, has always had an entrepreneurial spirit. After working as a stockbroker for twelve years at Merrill Lynch, Frank decided it was time to pursue his passion for gardening and spend more time at home with his four children. Three years ago, Frank began harvesting and selling basil plants out of his backyard.

 He buys basil seedlings and nurtures the plants until they are three to four feet tall. Once the plants are able to be plucked and used regularly with little maintenance, Frank sells them on consignment to markets, food stands, and retail stores. Although the business began informally, Basil World quickly gained popularity, and Frank found himself with a growing number of clients and buyers. 

Frank recently has been presented with the opportunity to sell his basil plants to five Market Basket stores throughout the Northeast. This contract would allow Frank to quadruple his sales over the summer. However, in order to meet this demand, Frank needs money to purchase as many seedlings as possible and to hire additional employees. This loan will help Frank fulfill this large contract and continue to grow his basil business.

loans.use: to purchase basil seedlings and hire additional employees.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Doña María Luisa, tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Hace más de tres años que estableció su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, refrescos, embutidos, azúcar, productos de limpieza etc. Ha solicitado 10 ciclos de prestamos con el actual que es por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de productos como granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, churros y otros. Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, que crezca para obtener ingresos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María Luisa is 61 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and one of her children in a town in the Choloma area, Cortes.

She set up her own business over three years ago. She runs a small grocery store where she sells staple grains, soft drinks, potato crisps, cold meats, sugar, and cleaning products, etc. 

This is her 10th loan cycle. The loan she is requesting is for 20,000 Lempiras. She plans to use the money to stock her shop with goods such as staple cereals, dairy products, cold meats, soft drinks, and potato crisps, among other products. 

Her aim is to improve her business so that it can grow and she can earn a better income, and then make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to stock her business with products such as staple grains, dairy products, cold meats, soft drinks, and potato crisps, etc.

loans.name: Iris Leticia

texts.es: Iris, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Iris es muy emprendedora desde joven aprendió a elaborar piñatas, hace 10 años que comenzó con su propio negocio donde elabora y vende piñatas de diferentes diseños. Vende en su casa, en los mercados y de forma ambulante.  Esta solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar los materiales como papel china, pegamento, alambre y otros para elaborar las piñatas. Su objetivo es mantener el negocio surtido de materiales para cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes, y que su negocio crezca para tener un bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Iris is 28 years old, is married with 4 children, and lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlantida.  Iris is very enterprising and learned to make pinatas when she was young.  10 years ago she started her own business making and selling pinatas from different designs.  She sells from her house, in markets and as a mobile vendor.  She is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy materials such as tissue paper, glue, wire and other things to make pinatas.  He goal is to keep her business supplied with materials to fill her customers' orders, and to grow her business for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as tissue paper, glue, wire and other things to make pinatas.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Saniya est composé de dix  femmes qui sont majoritairement mariées dans les familles polygamiques Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Djoni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, tomates, sel, plantes comestibles, etc.
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mafounè (2eme femme assise sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes  dans le village de Djoni et ses environs. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs d’oignon. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Djoni  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mafounè compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Saniya is composed of ten women who are for the most part married in polygamous families. The women average 36 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Djoni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses involving condiments, tomatoes, salt, edible plants, etc. 

With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Mafounè (the second woman sitting from the right in the photo) is a major seller of condiments of all kinds in and around the village of Djoni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of onions. Sales are made in cash or on credit by going door to door in the village of Djoni. Her customer base is composed mostly of women. 

Ms. Mafounè plans on making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and to ensure the children are cared for.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est composé de dix femmes qui sont majoritairement  mariées et monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Djoni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de riz, de farine de blé, du sucre et du poisson. 
Dans le but de consolider leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (1ere femme debout a gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de riz de toute sorte. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 160kg de riz. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Djoni et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Fanta  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants. Son objectif est de pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Tièssiri is composed of ten women who are for the most part married in monogamous families. The women average 38 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Djoni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship. They have small-scale businesses involving rice, wheat flour, sugar, and fish. 

With the goal of consolidating their small businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Fanta (the first woman standing from the left in the photo) is a major seller of rice of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to purchase 160 kg of rice. Sales are made in cash or on credit by going door to door in the village of Djoni. Her customer base is composed  of men and women. 

Ms. Fanta plans on making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in the business and to ensure the children are cared for. Her goal is to make her business sustainable in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Elizabeth from Moriba town Bo. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 years and 22 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Elizabeth established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation costs to move the goods from her operation area to her house.

Elizabeth requires a loan in order to purchase more charcoal for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sayda Jaqueline

texts.es: Sayda, tiene 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo e hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.  Ella ha establecido su propio negocio para generar  ingresos para su familia. Tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, huevos, pan, dulces, azúcar, manteca, papel higiénico, jabón, etc.  Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para surtir de más productos que le hacen falta como granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, churros, refrescos, y otros. Su meta es tener variedad de productos, hacer que crezca y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Twenty-seven year-old Sayda has two children and lives with her husband and children in a suburb of San Pedro Sula. 

She started her own business to generate an income for her family. She has a small grocery store that sells basic necessities such as dry grains, eggs, bread, candies, sugar, butter, toilet paper, soap, etc. 

She has decided to request a loan of 12,000 Honduran Lemprias to stock up on the products she needs: dry grains, butter, sugar, "churros" (donuts), soft drinks, and other items. 

Her goal is to have variety of products to make her business grow and to be able to help her family.

loans.use: To stock up on products for her business such as dry grains, butter, sugar, "churros" (donuts), soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Mirna Sulema

texts.es: Mirna vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Mirna lives in her own house with her life partner.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items like beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  

She has had her business for a many years, and this has gifted her with sales experience that allows her to get better profits.  It is located at her house.  It is very well-known among the neighbors in the area.  She has made a lot of customers; the store is stocked.

She wants to make her business grow.  She wants to make a new investment, but she needs the capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store.  She affirms that she will repay the loan, and she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products like eggs, cooking oil, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Gregorio  Antonio

texts.es: Gregorio es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, vive junto a tres hijos y su esposa. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar.  Gregorio solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, además de semillas de frijol y maiz, abonos y tambien para mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde desea sembrar sus cultivos. Gregorio ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y asi darle a su familia una mejor estbailidad economica.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a very kind and hard-working person.  He lives with his three children and his wife.

He works very hard on his own piece of land where he grows corn and beans.  His products are very good quality.  His land is in an area of easy access. This is very good for him because his customers are able to go directly to his place.

Gregorio is requesting a loan in order to have the money he needs to buy agricultural supplies.  He will buy things like pesticides and fertilizers.  He will also buy bean and corn seeds and manure to improve the land that is shown in the photograph.  This is where he wishes to plant his crops.

Gregorio longs to increase his sales in order to be able to get greater profits.  This way he will give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Denis Orlando

texts.es: Don Denis de 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus padres quienes trabajan y son muy responsables a igual que él son conocidos en la zona como personas trabajadoras y responsables, Denis se dedica al cultivo de frijoles y hortalizas que es con lo que logra satisfacer sus necesidades económicas. El solicita un credito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas, pesticidas, herbicidas, etc. para cultivar el fríjol junto con las hortalizas y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde piensa sembrar asi como muestra la fotografia, y así poder obtener mejores ventas para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con sus familia.
texts.en: Denis is 34 years old and lives in a home of his own along with his parents who work and are very responsible and known in the zone for being hardworking and responsible people.  Denis raises beans and vegetables and this allows him to meet his financial needs.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy farming supplies such as compost, seeds, pesticides, herbicides, etc. so that he can raise the beans with the vegetables and be able to improve the land where he wants to plant; as shown in the photograph.  In this way he will be able to improve his sales and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sharon Elizabeth

texts.es:
La joven Sharon vive en la cuidad de Managua es licenciada en administración de empresa,  trabaja en  una universidad   en el área de recepción,  tiene un pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

Sharon esta solicitando un financiamiento para la  compra de materiales de construcción como  bloquez,arena, cemento para la construcción de una pared  para darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda
texts.en:
Sharon lives in Managua and is licensed as a company manager.  She works reception at a university and has a young school-aged son.

Sharon is seeking a loan so that she can buy building materials such as cinder blocks, sand, and cement so that she can build a wall to provide better security to her home and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Hawa from Moriba town Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 12 years. Her children are currently going to school. She began her business because she doesn’t want to depend on her husband alone and she wants to contribute in the home.

Hawa runs a used bags business. She sells used bags within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well. She will use the profits to take care of her family.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to purchase more used bags. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a television to improve her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used bags to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Mary from Torkpoitown Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Mary established her general stock business. She began her business because she wants to engage in doing something for her living. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes business is very difficult.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase Maggie (bouillon), tomato paste, rice, cigarettes, and batteries. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's status of living. In the future, Mary plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Maggie (bouillon), tomato paste, rice, cigarettes, and batteries.

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Neneh from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 6 and 25. Four of her children are going to school.

Neneh runs a retail business. She sells pure water and soft drinks. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power of customers and lack of enough capital to expand her business. 

Neneh has requested a loan in order to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pure water and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: La Sra. Tomasa  sigue con la misma actividad de la agricultura, plantando papa, yuca y variedad de hortalizas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la siembra de yuca, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para el preparado de la tierra ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en:
Tomasa continues with the same job in agriculture planting potatoes, yuca, and a variety of vegetables.  She says it went well for her with the previous loan because she used it to plant yuca.

She's requesting this loan to buy potato seeds and also to prepare the land, because there's a lot of demand for this crop right now.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Satta from Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with 4 children. Despite her poor condition, she started this business to be recognized in the community. 

Satta runs a food stand business; she sells pepper, palm oil, and cigarettes. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 10 hours per days and 7 days per week. She says that her major problem is lack of enough finance to run her business. 

Satta has requested a loan in order to buy more pepper, palm oil, and cigarettes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to develop herself and able to take her daily meal. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pepper, palm oil, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 31 años de edad ,es madre de una niña de 8 años a quien cría en la casa de su mamá, ella trabaja mucho pues lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su menor hija y consolidarse económicamente.Consuelo se dedica a la venta de pollos. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias ya que su lugar de trabajo esta muy bien ubicado en una esquina visible de la calle, pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso .En esta oportunidad solicita S/. 3500, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir incrementado su negocio y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de buen peso y tamaño.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 31 years old and the mother of an eight year old girl whom she raises at her mother’s house.  She works hard because she wants to provide a better quality of life to her young daughter and consolidate her finances.

Consuelo sells chicken.
