She has a stall at one of the most popular markets and fortunately has good considerable sales and earnings because her work place is well located on a visible corner on the street.  This work demands lots of sacrifice and so she has to get up very early in the morning to get to the chicken supply centers so she can beat the others who also sell chicken, in order to buy the best and freshest products that she offers to her customers.

She knows that all of her effort is worth it and is rewarded when she sees that her young daughter has everything she needs to be comfortable.  She has been in this business for four years and works alone.  She says that she wants to do things right and generate financial resources for her family who are her main motivation.  She is asking for 3,500 PEN and is grateful to those who make this loan possible so she can grow her business.  She is committed to making her payments on time and will use the money to buy chickens of good size and weight.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad luchadora con muchos deseos de superarse ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación cursado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarla. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña ya que por tradición se han dedicado a esta actividad. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café y el terreno que ella junto a su esposo cultiva es propio ya que fue una herencia por parte de sus suegros, el cual está ubicado a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Doña María solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café ya que por medio de estos productos ella podrá asegurar su cosecha y podrá evitar que sean infectadas por plagas y enfermedades como la roya.

Sus sueños son de hacer de sus cultivos más productivos ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar el futuro de sus hijos formando un capital para darle sus estudios y tengan un mejor estilo de vida y mejores ingresos cuando ellos se gradúen a nivel universitario.
texts.en: Maria is a 28-year-old woman.  She is a fighter with a great desire to get ahead.  She is married and is the mother of 3 children who are in different grades at primary school.  She did not complete any level of education because her parents were poor and could not help her.  They taught her to work the land when she was very young because they had traditionally worked at this activity.  She has a great deal of experience as she has worked growing coffee for more than 8 years.  The land that she cultivates together with her husband is their own, and was inherited from her parents-in-law.  The land is located 100 meters from her house and she goes there daily on foot.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee crop, because with these products she can guarantee her harvest and avoid it being infected by pests and diseases such as blight.  Her dream is to make her crop more productive because this is how she will ensure her children's future, by saving money for their education so that they will have a better lifestyle and better incomes once they graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 23 years old and married with 2 children, ages 1 year and 6 years. She runs a food stand business in Torkpoi town in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 4 years and sells pepper, rice, cooking oil, Maggie (bouillon) and fish.   She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run the business.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more pepper, rice, cooking oil, Maggie, and fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and educate her child. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, cooking oil, Maggie (bouillon) and fish for resale.

loans.name: Hernán Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Herman Ramón vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como conductor  en una institución del estado con mucho años de estabilidad. En estos momentos está atravesando momentos difíciles por el fallecimiento de su esposa.

Don Herman está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como bloque arena cemento y pago de mano de obra  para mejorar su vivienda para darles  mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos que ahora solo cuenta con el apoyo de él. 

A la vez se siente bien agradecido ya que gracias a los créditos obtenidos por kiva ceprodel ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida para su familia .
texts.en:
Herman Ramon lives in Managua and has been working for a number of years as a driver for a state agency.  He is going through hard times because of his wife’s death.

Herman is asking for a loan so that he can buy building materials such as cinder blocks, sand, cement, and pay for labor so that he can make improvements to his house, in order to provide his children with better living conditions who now only have him to support them.

He is very grateful and thankful for the loans though Kiva and CEPRODEL because he has been improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 21 years old and single. She has two children, aged one and four. She runs a general stock in Torkpoi town, Sierra Leone. She started her business to generate income to support her children.

She's been in this business for seven years, selling cosmetics, soda, and batteries at home. She says that the main challenge is insufficient capital to run the business.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cosmetics, soda, and batteries. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the life of her family and increase her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, soda, and batteries to sell

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 29 años de edad vive con sus padres en casa propia, el cliente se dedica a la venta de sandia, tiene buena demanda de su producto ya que tiene 15 años de tener el negocio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Faustino solicita un credito para la compra de sandias por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela porque las vende a un precio considerado y asi el obtendra mejores ganancias para tener un mejor vida con sus padres.
texts.en: Faustino is 29 years old and lives with his parents in a home of his own.  He sells watermelon and has a good quality product after having had this business for 15 years.  His earnings allow him to cover his household expenses.  Faustino is asking for a loan in order to buy watermelon in quantity because he has many customers.  He sells at prices considered to be good and in this way he will have better earnings and a better quality of life with his parents.

loans.use: to buy watermelon.

loans.name: Gerardo Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo Manuel vive en la cuidad trabaja  en una centro de estudios universitario como conductor desde hace dos años, es casado  con tres hijos pequeños .

Está solicitando a kiva ceprodel un crédito para la compra de zinc  para su vivienda ya que con la venida  del invierno lo considera necesario. para darles mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Geraldo Manuel lives in the city and has been working at a university center as a driver for two years.  He’s married and has three young children.

He is asking for a loan through Kiva and CEPRODEL so he can buy zinc sheets for his house.  The winter is approaching and he thinks it necessary to provide more comfort to his family

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single man. He is well-known among his family and friends as an ambitious man, and he is always looking to improve himself to achieve a better future.

In the past three years, Ahmad has established his own project, selling computers and accessories to customers. He is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing more computers and a new collection of accessories to sell. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income.

The photo show Ahmad inside his store.

loans.use: to buy computers and their accessories

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en:
AbdulSalam is a Palestinian man. He is married and is the father of two sons and four daughters. AbdulSalam has been a municipal cleaner for one year. He earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover his family's needs.

AbdulSalam is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a machine to clean public places and gardens. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his work, and increase the family's income.

The photo shows AbdulSalam at work.

loans.use: To buy a machine to clean public places

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man. He lives in modest conditions with the rest of his family in Jabalia refugee camp. Mohammad works in repairing mobile phones and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover his needs. Mohammad also is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions.

Mohammad is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken next to their new house.

Fatema is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six sons. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Fatema wants to live with her family in better conditions, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing construction supplies such as wood, cement and iron to complete building the family's new house. Taking this loan will speed the process of completing their new house and enable Fatema and her family to enjoy living in their new house soon.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to complete building the family's house

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es:
“Manos Unidas” es una alcancía conformada por 06 socias, una de las integrantes del grupo es Ruth de 33 años. Ella es viuda  tiene  03 hijos pequeños. Ruth se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en su mayoría ropa y zapatos, este trabajo lo realiza desde su casa, aun no cuenta con un lugar para ello debido al costo elevado del alquiler de locales, ya tiene varios años trabajando de esa manera y le va bien, cuenta con muchos clientes que le solicitan diversos productos, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar ropa y zapatos por campaña del día de la madre, esas fechas son muy buenas para su negocio porque las ventas mejoran, gracias a su trabajo puede velar por su familia ya que ella es el único sustento, mas adelante le gustaría tener un bazar en un local propio.
Ruth está entusiasmada por el apoyo que recibe en su negocio. A todos los inversionistas les quiere decir ¡Muchas gracias! En la foto viste pantalón color rojo.
texts.en:
“Manos Unidas” is a communal bank made up of 6 members. One of the group members is Ruth who is 33 years old. She is a widow and has 3 small children. Ruth sells various products, mostly clothing and shoes. She works from home, not having a facility for her work because of the high cost of renting sites.

She has several years experience along this line and she is doing well. She has many customers that ask for different products. The loan that she has requested will be used to buy clothing and shoes for the Mother’s Day campaign. Those dates are very good for her business because sales increase. 

Thanks to her work she can provide for her family as she is the only breadwinner. In the future she would like to have a bazaar in her own facility. Ruth is excited by the support she is receiving in her business. To all the lenders she wants to say, Many thanks! In the photo she is wearing red pants.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Bondades De Mujer Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo “Bondades de Mujer”

Grupo conformado por 06 integrantes, una de ellas es Jeny joven soltera de 35 años, en el grupo tiene el cargo de secretaria. Jeny brinda servicios de costura, alquiler de vestidos y disfraces. Este negocio lo maneja desde su casa ya tiene 09 años trabajando y le agrada mucho su oficio. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y alumnos de diferentes colegios que siempre la buscan para prestar sus servicios, gracias a su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia. Jeny ha solicitado este préstamo para mejorar su taller de costura y comprar materiales, mas adelante le gustaría abrir al público ya que por ahora solo atiende dentro de su casa. Esta agradecida por su préstamo a todos los inversionistas que hacen posible que tanto ella como su grupo puedan progresar.
Jeny es la segunda de la izquierda viste polo marron y jean celeste.
texts.en:
This is the “Bondades de Mujer” group.

This group is made up of six members, one of whom is Jeny.  She is young, single, 35 years old and serves as the group's secretary.  Jeny sews and rents out dresses and costumes.  She runs this business from her home and has been working it for nine years.  She likes her work very much.  Her customers are her friends, neighbors, and students from different schools who seek out her services.  Thanks to her work, she is able to meet her family expenses and help her family.  Jeny is asking for this loan so that she can improve her sewing workshop and buy supplies.  In the future she would like to open to the public; at the moment she only sells out of her home.  She is grateful for the loan and to the lenders who made it possible for and her group to get ahead. 

Jeny is the second on the right wearing a moroon polo shirt and jeans.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 52 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y que a pesar de su edad no deja de soñar en grande. Ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales viven en su casa los dos mayores estudian y la ultima es de tan solo 3 años de edad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y agradece a sus padres por el apoyo que le brindaron para que ella pudiera tener un conocimiento básico ya que ellos son de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar café desde muy joven y actual mente ella se dedica hace más de 30 años en compañía de su esposo a esta actividad. Ella aparte de ser caficultora también se dedica al comercio en lo que es la elaboración de pan el cual lo elabora también en compañía de sus hijos el cual es comercializado en la zona donde ella habita.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café y el vivero que está poniendo en pie por medio del cual podrá obtener una cosecha sana y la podrá aprovechar al 100%.

Sus sueños son los de ver a sus hijos culminados a nivel universitario, que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
María, 52, is a determined and enterprising woman whose age doesn't keep her from dreaming big.  She's married and has three children who live in her house.  The two oldest are in school and the youngest is only three years old.

She finished elementary school and is grateful to her parents for the support they gave her so she could have a basic knowledge.  They have limited resources and were unable to continue helping her.  They were the ones who taught her to grow coffee from a very young age.  Currently she has more than 30 years of experience doing this job with her husband.

In addition to being a coffee grower she also works in retail making bread.  She makes it with one of her children and sells it in the area where she lives.

Currently she's requesting help to buy soil amendments and fertilizer for her coffee crop and the nursery she's setting up.  She hopes to get a healthy harvest and be able to make the most of it 100%.

Her dreams are to see her children finish college and have better opportunities in life and employment, because working the land is very difficult and there's not a lot of profit.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer to grow coffee

loans.name: Hijos De Grau Group

texts.es:
Karina es uno de los miembros del  grupo “Hijos de Grau”

Karina tiene 39 años, ella es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas. Karina trabaja vendiendo comida rápida salchipapas,hamburgesas y pollo broaster. Fue su hermana quien la animo a empezar este negocio, ya son cerca de 02 años y continua trabajando con mucho ánimo, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado un capital y puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, sobretodo en la educación de sus hijas.Karina ha empezado otro negocio la venta de ropa y calzado, el préstamo solicitado lo usara para comprar mercadería que sus clientes le han solicitado,ella quiere aprovechar estas fechas que son muy buenas para las ventas.
Karina está feliz de pertenecer a su grupo y quiere decir ¡Muchas Gracias!  A los inversores de KIVA 
En la foto es la primera de la izquierda viste de negro.
texts.en:
Karina is one of the members of the "Hijos de Grau" group.

Karina is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 daughters.  Karina works selling fast food such as salchipapas (a local, kebab-like food), hamburgers, and fried chicken.  Her sister is the one who encouraged her to start this business, which she has now had for about 2 years.  She continues to work with great enthusiasm.

Thanks to her job, she has been able to earn money and be help her husband with the family expenses (above all including the education of their daughters).

Karina has started another business selling clothes and shoes.  The loan that she's asking for will be to buy goods that her customers have requested.  She wants to take advantage of this time of year, which is very good in terms of sales.

Karina is happy to belong to her group and wants to say "thanks a lot!" to all Kiva investors.  In the picture, she is the first one on the left and is dressed in black.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, ella posee un negocio de  pupuseria desde hace  10 años vende de martes a domingos por la mañana y por la noche tienen mucha clientela pues vende las pupusas a buen precio y es una personam muy amable y trabajadora, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Doña Juana quiere acrecentar su negocio comprando mesas y sillas pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mesas y sillas, tambien materia prima para elaborar las pupusas como: maiz, aceite, quesillo, chicharron, frijoles, etc. y asi obtener mejores ganancias para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and five children.  She has a business selling pupusas which she has been running for 10 years.  She sells her pupusas from Tuesday to Sunday, in the mornings and evenings.  She has a lot of customers as she sells her pupusas at a good price and is a very friendly and hard-working person.  She uses the profits she makes to get her family ahead in life.

Juana would like to increase her business by purchasing tables and chairs. She doesn't make enough money to do this and so she is requesting a loan for this purpose.  She will also buy ingredients for making pupusas such as corn, oil, quesillo, ground pork, beans, etc.  This will make her better profits and she will be able to continue providing her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy quesillo, ground pork, beans, corn, tables and chairs

loans.name: Abdelkareem

texts.en:
Abdekareem is a 35-year-old married man and a father to one son and two daughters. Abdelkareem is a municipal employee who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Abdelkareem is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a refrigerator and washing machine for his house. This loan will enable Abdelkareem to improve his family's living conditions to be better. Abdelkareem appears in the photo.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and washing machine for home use.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, next to his taxi.

Hala is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past seven years, Hala's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover some costs.

Hala is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. This will enable Hala's husband to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to insure and license the taxi.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 58 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Se inicio en las actividades agrícolas hace más de 20 años  y su principal fuente de ingreso es el cacao orgánico.Posee un terreno agrícola en  el cual trabaja con bastante esmero ya que lo compro con el fruto de muchos años de trabajo como jornalera.Desde hace 10 años fue abandonada por su aun esposo haciéndose cargo de sus pequeños cultivos .Alrededor de sus parcelas podemos hallar plantaciones de cacao orgánico y achiote los cuales vende a los acopiadores zonales por ser productos  con mucha demanda.
Para desempeñar las tareas complicadas contrata a  jornaleros del lugar logrando recuperar su inversión a fin de campaña.En ocasiones a tenido que lidiar con inconvenientes por parte de enfermedades que afectan sus plantaciones así como plagas que perjudican su producción e incrementando del capital necesario para realizar su trabajo.Se siente muy orgullosa por brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación sin ayuda de su ex esposo.
A medida que pasan los años siente que las fuerzas se le van agotando es por ello que espera a futuro acumular dinero suficiente para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble y aperturar un pequeño negocio como una tienda de comestibles .Se siente contenta por recibir un segundo préstamo por Kiva, espera seguir contando con el apoyo financiero para cumplir sus objetivos y a su vez pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles y adquirir otro terreno de cultivo para la siembra de cacao esperando incrementar sus ingresos con una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Bertha is 58 years old and the single mother of three children with whom she lives in an adobe house.  She started farming more than 20 years ago and her main source of income is organic cacao.  She has farmland where she works with great enthusiasm, since she bought it after many years of hard work as a field hand.  After having been abandoned by her husband for ten years, she took charge of the crops.  On her land we can find organic cacao and achiote crops, which she sells to suppliers in the zone because these products are in high demand.

She will hire local field hands and will recover her investments at the end of the season.  At times she has had to deal with setbacks such as blights that affect her crops.  She needs an increase in capital to do this work.  She is proud to provide a good education for her children without help from her former husband.

She feels like she is getting weaker over the years and so she wants to save up enough money to start building a home out of solid materials and also start a small business like a food store.  She is happy to be getting a second loan through Kiva and is committed to make her payments on time.  She is asking for 3,000 PEN so she can acquire another plot of land on which to raise cacao and increase her income with greater production.

loans.use: Compra de terreno agrícola.

loans.name: Yungueñitas 27 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento YUNGUEÑITAS 27  está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Paulina tiene 68 años, casada con hijos ya independientes, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Pedro, Domingo Murrillo , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Paulina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la  Sra. Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Yungueñitas 27 is made up of 8 members of whom 6 are women and 2 are men working in various activities.

The president of the bank is Paulina. She is 68 years old, married with adult children. She works weaving alpaca sweaters and blankets for women. She has her workshop and home in the area of Pedro, Domingo Murrillo.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution. Paulina is going to use this loan to buy wholesale alpaca wool for weaving her sweaters and blankets as at this time she has many sales and also sales deliveries to various markets in the city of El Alto.

Her reason for asking for this loan is to build up working capital. Paulina faces challenges in her business such as supplying her merchandise and she is going to use the loan proceeds to continue buying wholesale materials to weave her sweaters.

loans.use: to buy wholesale alpaca wool

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene 62 años, ella es viuda con hijos ya independientes, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  puesto de venta  que se encuentran en la zona de Hurujara,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Cristina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su puesto y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is 62 years old.  She is a widow and her children already live independently.  Her business is selling basic household goods from a sales location in Hurujara district.  This loan is her first from the institution.  She will use it to buy merchandise with which to stock her business.  She will buy sweet treats and soft drinks.

Cristina is requesting this loan as she has a lot of demand for her products and would like to increase her sales.  In order to do this, she needs to stock her business with merchandise.  Cristina faces challenges in her business such as competition from stores in her area.  She will use the profits that she makes to buy more merchandise so that she can continue growing her business.  Her business goal is to continue making sales and to have a well-stocked store so that she can grow her business, improve her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa tiene un negocio de ventas de distintos productos, ropas, zapatos, entre otros. Su negocio tiene ya 7 años operando en su misma casa. Está solicitando un préstamo de 42,000 pesos para comprar una caja de ropas y zapatos y otros equipos de computadora. Con esta inversión en el negocio, sus ventas aumentaran y así mismo sus ganancias. Ella desea en un futuro poder construir un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Santa has a business selling different types of goods, including clothes, shoes, and other things.  She has been running her business from her house for 7 years.

She is asking for a loan for 42,000 pesos (US$1,025) to buy a box of clothes and clothes, as well as some computer equipment.  With this investment that she will make in her business, her sales and profits will increase.

In the future, she wants to be able to build a permanent venue for her store.

loans.use: buy a box of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Omar De Jesús

texts.es:
Omar de 55 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas en su barrio. Gracias a esta actividad puede generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su producción, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la adquisición de un carro de comidas rápidas. 
Su mayor sueño es tener estabilidad económica y mejorar la calidad de vida su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Omar is 55 years old and works preparing and selling fast food in his neighborhood.  Thanks to this job, he is able to make enough money to sustain his family.  With the hope of improving his sales and increasing his production, he is asking for a loan for the purpose of buying a fast food cart.

His greatest desire is to obtain economic stability and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is applying for a loan of $1,500.00 to improve her business. She is running a motorcycle service business in front of her house. She is making a good income from motorcycle services and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan and pay for the mechanic who works for her. She is living in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to fix their motorcycles. She opened her business in 2004 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to sell workshop equipment such as inner tubes, engine oil, etc. for her motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Aguida

texts.en:
Aguida is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits and other items. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $600.

Aguida is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits and other items.

loans.name: Gabriela Martinez

texts.es: Gabriela de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; Ella posee un chalet donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, pan, frijoles, arroz, leche, huevos, embutidos entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, tiene mucha clientela porque vende productos de primera calidad a precios bajos, y es muy amable; ella quiere invertir en su negocio comprando mas productos para surtir su tienda por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos productos instantáneos, bebidas etc. Gabriela tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 55 years old and lives with her family in her own home. She has a stand where she sells staples, bread, beans, rice, milk, eggs, and sausages among others. She has been in business several years and that has given her valuable experience permitting her to obtain higher earnings. She has many customers because she sells quality products at low prices, and she is very friendly.

She wants to invest in her business buying more products to supply her store so she is asking for a loan in order to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, eggs, instant products, drinks, etc.

Gabriela has good payment references and is very responsible. She says that she can pay her debt and at the same time she hopes that this will allow her to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Isis Damaris

texts.es: Isis, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo y vive en el municipio de taulabe. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace 8 meses ubico su negocio en el mercado local donde alquila un puesto de venta. Vende ropa de segunda mano para damas y niños, como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar más ropa de segunda para incrementar las ventas. Su sueño es que el negocio vaya en crecimiento.
texts.en:
Isis is 31 years old, married, and has 1 child. She lives in the town of Taulabe.

She has always worked in commerce and 8 months ago set up her business in the local market where she rents a stall. She sells second hand clothing for ladies and children, such as blouses, dresses, pants, skirts and more. 

She has decided to ask for a loan of 20,000 lempiras in order to buy more second hand clothing in order to increase sales. Her dream is that the business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
This is Anecita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed grocery items for her variety store. The loan helped in their household expenditures. She has been in this business for five years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maribel hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her husband will get better. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Jelosil

texts.en:
This is Jelosil, 45, resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Antonio and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jelosil operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jelosil hopes that her variety store will be a grocery store and dreams to give her family a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita works hard to support her family. Alita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Alita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Alita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Alita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and has one child who is in school.

Arlene has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Arlene has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris
Puntarenas
500000

	Damaris tiene 48 años de edad vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en la zona de Fray Casiano, Puntarenas, es un barrio pobre  y como muchas limitaciones. La clienta  se presenta como una persona con muchos deseos de superarse, se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y artesanías desde hace 10 años. Ella está  en constante capacitación para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de mayor calidad. Además de adornos, elabora bolsos,  ropa para artículos electrodomésticos y para el baño y productos para fiestas de cumpleaños y otras actividades como primera comunión y bautizos, manejando productos de calidad, es ampliamente conocida en la zona por dedicarse a este trabajo, por lo que no le falta clientela durante el año.

	Inició comprando una pequeña cantidad de material con ayuda de su esposo hace 10 años, empezó a capacitarse y mejorar las técnicas y por ende diversificar su producción, aumentando su clientela y mejorando sus ingresos, el objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima y algunas herramienta, ya que dada la calidad de su trabajo la buscan de escuelas y colegios de la zona para elaborar materiales alusivos a fiestas del calendario escolar.

	 Ella se dedica a su trabajo durante la mayor parte del día, su hija mayor está en la Universidad y los menores de edad se encuentran estudiando, por lo que su primer labor del día es prepararles la comida para que vayan al colegio y escuela, debido a la gran cantidad de encargos trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que realiza el trabajo de forma manual, pero una vez reparada la máquina este se agilizará incrementando así su producción y el tiempo que comparte con su familia.

	La limitante principal ha sido la falta de dinero, pero esta oportunidad de crédito le va a permitir contar con capital para comprar materia prima y poder así incrementar su producción, y cumplir así el sueño de arreglar su casa. Ella canceló su primer préstamo y desea continuar teniendo el apoyo de Fundación Mujer y KIVA para apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Damaris is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Fray Casiano, Puntarenas zone.  It’s a poor neighborhood with many limitations.  [Damaris] is a person with many desires of getting ahead.  She has been making arts and crafts for the past ten years.  She is constantly teaching herself so that she can offer high quality products to her customers.  Aside from decorations, she makes quality purses, covers for appliances, bath articles, and products for birthday parties, first communions, and baptisms.  She is well known in the zone for being dedicated to this work and so she is not in need of customers during the year.

She began by buying a small amount of items with her husband’s help, began training herself and improving her techniques.  She diversified her production, increasing her number of customers, and improving her income.  The goal for this loan is to buy supplies and some tools.  Schools from the area seek her out to make things for school parties due to the quality of her work.

She works throughout most of the day and her daughter is in university.  Her younger children attend school.  Her first daily task is to prepare food for them so they can go to school.  Given the great quantity of orders, she works into the night.  She does her work by hand but once the machine is repaired things will speed up and she can increase her production and spend more time with her family.

Her main obstacle has been lack of capital, but this loan will allow her to have the money she needs to buy supplies and increase her production and reach her dream of fixing up her hose.  She repaid her first loan and wants to continue having support from Fundación Mujer and Kiva so she can support her children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy art supplies.

loans.name: Nery

texts.en:
This is Nery. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nery dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lowana

texts.fr: Lowana est une jeune homme de 37ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Il est revendeur d’habits et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il espère avoir d’autres succursales et assurer l’éducation de son petit frère.
texts.en: Lowana is a young 37-year-old man. He is single and has no children in his care. He is a reseller of clothes and is requesting his first loan to buy more merchandise. He hopes to have additional branches of his business and provide for his little brother's education.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Koumbon

texts.fr: Veuve de 46ans, Koumbon est mère d’un enfant de 18ans qui est scolarisé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des céréales et des produits divers sous un hangar devant son domicile. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des céréales.  Son souhait est de s’installer dans un marché et être en mesure de subvenir aux moindres besoins de son enfant.
texts.en: A 46-year-old widow, Koumbon is the mother an 18-year-old child who is in school. To provide for the needs of her family, she sells cereals and various products out of a shed in front of her home. To better address the needs of her family, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy cereals. Her greatest wish is to move her business into a market and to be able to provide for all of her child's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jose Matilde

texts.es: Don jose vive en casa propia con sus dos hijo, él se dedica a vender refrescos y licuados su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar, Don jose solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia como jugos, gaseosas, agua, y fruta como: guineos, papaya, melon, etc. para hacer los licuados ya que ultimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y asi poder surtir de mas productos su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home with his two children. He makes a living selling soft drinks and smoothies. His business is located in his residence. He already has many customers since he sells his products at a good price. With the sales he makes he manages to obtain good profits that serve to cover the costs of his home and other necessities that can present themselves.

José is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise like juices, sodas, water, and fruit, such as: bananas, papayas, melons, etc. to make the smoothies since he recently has had a lot of demand. In this way, he will be able to supply his business with more products and obtain better profits to give to his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, and fruit to make smoothies.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra en la zona cota cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas en un instituto como profesor de cocina, y los fines de semana atiende eventos en diferentes lugares, ya que con sus ingresos debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, alquiler, transporte y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de vajilla y algunas ollas ya que desea  mejorar su atención en eventos los fines de semana en el área de comida buffet y de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos.
El sueño de Andres es adquirir un anticrético para habilitar un patio-recreo y brindar atención de comida nacional e internacional a sus clientes.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Andres is single and has no children. He lives in a rented house that has three rooms. The house is located in the District of Cota Cota in the city of La Paz.

Andres currently works more than eight hours at an institution as a cooking instructor. On the weekends, he caters events at different places. With his earnings, he is able to cover expenses such as food, rent, transportation, and basic services. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy dishes and a few pots because he wants to improve his service at the weekend events where he provides a buffet. This will enable him to improve his income.

Andres dreams of acquiring a rental property that is equipped with a patio and recreational area where he can serve local and international foods to his clients. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dishes and pots for his weekend catering events.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, a 49-year-old resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Arturo, a plumber, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Josephine dreams of having her own stall for the business and hopes to have their own house.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y sus esposa en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Siguatepeque. Desde pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura ahora tiene su propia finca de hace 6 años. La producción que saca la vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de café y poder mejorar la producción. El préstamo es por 20,000 Lempiras. Su objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a neighborhood in the town of Suguatepeque.

From a young age he has worked in agriculture and now he has been managing his own farm for the past six years. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market. Miguel has decided to request his third loan in order to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee crop so that he can improve production. The loan is in the amount of 20,000 HNL. His goal is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Célibataire de 29ans, Mr Koffi est électronicien de profession. Vu que le métier ne passe pas comme il le souhaite, il a ajouté la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Il a démarré son activité en 2008 et par moment, il est exposé à la crise de mévente. Il sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. A l’avenir, il espère devenir un grand commerçant et se marier plus tard.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi is a single 29-year-old man who is an electronics technician by trade. His profession not being quite as he expected, he added the sales of general food items. He started his activity in 2008 and at times he has to deal with the lack of sales.

He is requesting this third loan from WAGES to buy general food items. In the future he hopes to become a large retailer and later get married.

loans.use: to buy general food items

loans.name: Coumbayel's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en octobre 2012,  est à son second cycle dans le programme. Les femmes commencent à maîtriser les caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village, l’activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Coumbayel (assise à l’extrême droite dans la seconde rangée) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 51 ans, est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont deux filles. Son activité consiste l’achat de riz et d’huile qu’elle revend au village et de légumes qu’elle vend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs de riz, d’ognon, de l’huile pour la revente au détail au village.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
This group, formed in October 2012, is on its second loan cycle in the program. The women have begun to master the ins and outs of credit and savings. They all live in the same town, and their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Coumbayel (sitting all the way on the right in the second row), is the featured borrower. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are girls. Her activity consists of buying rice and oil, which she resells in town, and vegetables, which she sells at the weekly markets.

With this loan, she intends to buy bags of rice, onions, and oil for resale at retail in town.

The profits will serve to help her husband in providing for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, onions, and oil for resale at retail in town.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María de 63 años de edad, viuda con hijos adultos e independientes. Ella es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Rosar María es una mujer trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad por falta de recursos económicos.

Lamentablemente es ano pasado quedo viuda,  ella tenía el negocio de reparación de zapatos y quien lo ejercía era el esposo. A raíz de su muerte cambio de negocio ahora tiene por actividad económica la venta de Refresco naturales como granadia, cebada, linaza ,ensalada de frutas, pina, cacao, galletas y repostería, negocio que lo tiene ubicado  en su casa de habitación. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 6 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar frutas azúcar, sal, bolsas pajillas. Para la preparación de los refresco, para que en un futuro no muy lejano  pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosa María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de  escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 63 years old, widowed, and has adult children who are independent. She is originally from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Rosa María is a hardworking and responsible woman who wants to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, she was not able to study and was obligated to work at an early age because she lacked financial resources.

Sadly, Rosa María became a widow last year. She had a shoe repair business that was managed by her husband. Following his death, she changed businesses and now has a venture in which she sells natural refreshments such as passion fruit, barley, linseed, fruit salad, pineapple, cacao, cookies, and pastries. Her business is located in her home. Rosa María takes great pleasure in running her business. She works approximately six hours a day.

The goal with this loan is to invest operating capital in the purchase of fruits, sugar, salt, bags, and straws for preparing refreshments. In the near future, she would like to generate more income. Rosa María is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy fruits, sugar, salt, bags, and straws for preparing refreshments.

loans.name: Siring's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en octobre 2012,  est à son second cycle dans le programme. Les femmes commencent à maîtriser les caractéristiques du crédit et de l’épargne. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village, l’activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Siring (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle fait de la transformation de produits agricoles plus particulièrement la pâte d’arachide qui consiste à acheter des graines d’arachide à décortiquer puis les griller pour les moudre en pâte.

Avec son crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter trois sacs de graines d’arachide non décortiquées pour la transformation et la vente.

Avec les bénéfices,  elle compte apporter sa contribution dans la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group, formed in October 2012, is on its second loan cycle in the program. The women have begun to master the ins and outs of credit and savings. They all live in the same town, and their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Siring (sitting all the way on the right, with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She processes agricultural products, specifically to make peanut paste, which consists of buying peanuts for shelling and then grilling them to grind into paste.

With this loan, she intends to buy three bags of unshelled peanuts to process and sell.

With the profits, she intends to do her share in providing for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy three bags of unshelled peanuts for processing and selling.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 16 octobre 2012 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui sont au second cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Maïmouna (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Elle achète au marché hebdomadaire des légumes frais et autres condiments pour la revente au village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter en quantité des condiments et de mieux assurer son approvisionnement en légumes frais.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille : éducation et santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Formed on 16 October 2012 at the inauguration of the village loan fund, this group comprises women who are on their second loan cycle in the village loan program. They all come from the same village, share strong group links, and help each other. Their main activity is running small businesses.

Ms. Maïmouna (standing all the way on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and has three children, two of whom are girls. She buys fresh vegetables and other condiments at the weekly market for resale in the village.

Her new loan will allow her to buy condiments in bulk and better ensure her supply of fresh vegetables.

With the profits, she intends to better support her husband in providing for the family, specifically her children's education and health.

loans.use: To buy condiments in bulk and better ensure her supply of fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Née vers 1976 à KANGARE, MASSARAN vit avec son enfant et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier KANGARE de la ville de SELINGUE. 
MASSARAN n’a pas eu la chance d aller a l école,  très vite s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de l’encens, des pagnes  bazin et des produit de beauté.  Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents MASSARAN est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante d’encens, 20 pièces de bazin et quelques cartons produits de beauté auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail dans sa boutique à KANGARE,  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MASSARAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in Kangare, Massaran lives with her husband and child in a monogamous household in the Kangaré area of the city of Sélingué.
Massaran did not have the opportunity to go to school, and very quickly became interested in income-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of incense, damask pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing), and cosmetics. After having properly repaid her previous loans, Massaran is on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy a large quantity of incense, 20 sets of damask pagnes, and several boxes of cosmetics from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales in cash, on credit, and at retail at her store in Kangaré to a clientele composed of men and women.
Massaran hopes to realize a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to help her husband provide for the family, to repay the loan, and the reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy and sell various items.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SALIF est âgé de 53 ans et vit avec son épouse dans la sous préfecture de KANGARE, Région de SIKASSO.
Très tôt Salif s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  fruits et légumes, qu’il apprit auprès de son frère, qui  fut jadis l’un des grands producteurs et vendeurs de fruits et légumes. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter des fruits et légumes auprès des demi grossistes de KANGARE  qu’il revend en gros à BAMAKO au grossiste a crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
SALIF espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. SALIF is 53 years old and lives with his wife in the sub-prefecture of KANGARE, in Région de SIKASSO. Early on, Salif became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying and selling of fruit & vegetables which he learned from his brother, who used to be a major producer and vendor of fruit & vegetables.  

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his third individual loan, which will be used to purchase some fruit & vegetables from middlemen in KANGARE. Accepting cash or credit from a mixed customer base, he then resells the goods in bulk in BAMAKO.

Salif hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan. He will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Marco siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace 3 años el decidió por dedicarse a la compra y venta de cerdos. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y los utiliza para comprar mas cerdos que le están ofreciendo, luego los engorda y los vende. Su meta es crecer con su negocio y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 39 years old, is married, and has 5 children.  He lives with his family in a village of the city of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Marco has always worked in farming.  Three years ago, he decided to dedicate himself to the buying and selling of pigs.  He runs this business out of his house and has very good customers.

The loan that he is asking for is for 10,000 Lempiras (US$525) and he will use it to buy more pigs that are being offered to him.  After buying them, he will fatten them up and sell them.  His goal is to grow his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Carlos  Enrique

texts.es: Don Carlos de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Don Carlos solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas, foliares, semillas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cosechas y obtener mejores ganancias para una mejor vida con su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en: Carlos is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their three children in their own home. He has made a living for the past 20 years selling the basic grains he grows to cover household expenses. Carlos is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and other items to continue with his harvests and to earn more profits for a better life for his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Yamileth  Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yamileth mujer  humilde y trabajadora habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en el reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, su esposo la apoya siempre ya que con el negocio que ella tiene aporta gran parte a la economia del hogar, su esposo tambien tiene un negocio el elabora articulos de madera, con este credito que se le ha otorgado a doña Yamileth comprara productos de belleza como: Pinturas de Labios, Perfumenes, Polveras, Sombras etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en: Yamileth is a humble and hardworking woman who lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Her husband always supports her, since her business contributes to the family finances a great deal. Her husband has a business making wooden items. Yamileth is requesting the loan to purchase beauty products like lipstick, perfumes, powders, eye shadow and other items. She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva have provided.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Doña maricela de 43 años de edad posee un taller de costura desde hace 10 años en su lugar de residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas tambien vende productos de uso personal, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; élla es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, Doña Maricela esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura y tambien perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su familia podran tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricela is 43 years old and has had a sewing shop for 10 years, which she runs from her home.  There, she makes different types of clothing and also sells personal use goods.  Recently, she has gained many customers since the work that she does in excellent and she sells the items she makes at very reasonable prices.

She is a very dedicated to her work and is responsible and honest.  Maricela is asking for a loan that will allow her to continue satisfying the needs of her customers.  In this way, she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy thread, needles, buttons, fabric, perfumes, creams, and other things.

loans.name: Keila Patricia

texts.es: Keila, tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa Valle, Santa Bárbara. Hace tres años que ella decidió establecer su propio negocio para darle la manutención a su hijo. Vende ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa intima y sandalias. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante. Para surtir más su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar más ropa(blusas, faldas, camisas,ropa intima) y sandalias para la venta e incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda de ropa para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su hijo.
texts.en: Keila is 19 years old and a single mother of one son. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa Valle, Santa Bárbara. Three years ago she decided to start her own business in order to support her son. She sells clothing like blouses, T-shirts, pants, lingerie and sandals around the city. To stock her business with more merchandise, Keila is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes (blouses, skirts, shirts, lingerie) and sandals to sell and increase her income. Her dream is to have a clothing store so she and her son can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing like blouses, skirts, shirts, undergarments and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Doña marta de 64 años de edad vive con junto con su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 5 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles, Doña Marta desea acrecentar su negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas ropa: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, ropa para niños, ropa inetrior, etc. ella  asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Marta is 64 years old and lives with her family in their own house. She dedicates herself to selling clothing. She has spent five years doing this work and it has given her a lot of experience which allows her to make better earnings. The business is located in a market which is near her residence. She has provided for a lot of clients because the people know everything has good quality and good prices. She wants to increase her business but doesn't have sufficient capital to support herself. For this reason she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy more clothes: pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, children's clothing, undergarments, etc. She is sure that she will repay the debt and at the same time has hope that it will bring her home economic security.

loans.use: buy blouses, undergarments, shorts, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain crops.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 55 years old and married with seven children, two of whom in school. Carina works very hard to provide for them.

Carina runs a grocery store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, shampoo, and other items to sell.

Carina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Carina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, shampoo, and other items to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works hard to support her family. Catherine is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Catherine has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods like soap, milk, coffee, spices, canned goods, and other items.

Catherine has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Catherine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods like soap, milk, coffee, spices, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Demetrio Celedonio

texts.es: El señor Demetrio, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, el trabaja la tierra desdes hace mas de 30 años, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del ya que ella es comerciante de Frutas y Verduras y con los ganancias ayuda con la economia del hogar, el cultiva piña y requiere de capital para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprar los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios, Agradece el apoyo brindado por Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Demetrio lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. He has been working the land for more than 30 years. His wife helps with the household expenses by selling fruits and vegetables. He grows pineapple and needs capital to maintain his crop.  With this loan he was able to buy the necessary supplies and fertilizers. He is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Andrica

texts.en:
This is Andrica, a 53-year-old resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages her own household along with her children while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Andrica operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy peanut butter in large quantities then sells smaller units at a profit. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 grams plastic bottles. She also has an apartment for rent. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of peanut butter.

Andrica dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her youngest will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more peanut butter needed in her business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Due to financial constraints, Josie engaged herself in the hog-raising business to help her husband earn additional income. They are currently residing in a rural community where the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn and vegetables. They wish to uplift their status of living in order to provide the needs of their family, especially for sending their children to school.  

For this reason, Josie is asking for additional capital of PHP 27,000 to buy the needed pig feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Having patience and strong determination, she and her husband believe that they will be able to improve their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: El señor Ceferino, hombre humilde, trabajador habita en el municipio de La Concepcion, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en todas sus decisiones, su esposa es comerciante vende Frutas y Verduras, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, don Ceferino cultiva Piña y quiere aprovechar antes que entre el Invierno darle Mantenimeinto a sus cultivos, con este Financiamiento que se le ha otorgado comprara los insumos y fertilizantes idoneos para optimo y mejor cuidado de su cosecha, Agradece a Afodenic quien en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le han brindado la confianza y ayuda  necesaria
texts.en:
Ceferino is a humble, hard-working man who lives in the town of La Concepción.  His wife and children support him in the decicions he makes.  His wife sells fruits and vegetables and they share the household expenses.  Ceferino grows pineapple and wants to take advantage before the winter to carry out crop maintenance.

With this loan he will buy supplies and the best fertilizers he can to give his crop better care.  He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in him and for providing the necessary help.

loans.use: To buy supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Lidia Yanet

texts.es: Lidia de 39 años de edad vive con sus hijos y su mama en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa. Lidia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su trabajo quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas ropa como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, ropa para niños, cosméticos etc. asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Lidia, 39, lives with her children and mother in her own house.  She sells clothing and cosmetics and has been in business for several years.  This has given her much experience, allowing her to earn more profit.  Her business is set up near her home.

Lidia is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and wants to carry out a new investment.  She does not have sufficient capital to back her so she is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as skirts, blouses, dresses, children's clothing, cosmetics, etc.  She is committed to paying back the loan and hopes to provide her home with more economic security.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia
